description: "Aep Gai" ( แอ็บไก่ ) is a northern Thai preparation in which minced chicken is mixed with fresh herbs, a spice paste, and beaten eggs. The mixture is wrapped in banana leaves and then grilled over charcoal.
thaiName: แอ็บไก่

description: "Aep Moo" ( แอ็บหมู ) is a northern Thai preparation in which minced pork is mixed with herbs and spices, wrapped in banana leaves, and then grilled over charcoal. Depending on the variant, fermented soybeans and other regional seasonings may also be added.
thaiName: แอ็บหมู

description:
"Aep Plaa" ( แอ็บปลา ) or “Plaa Aep” ( ปลาแอ็บ ) is ground fish mixed with herbs and shrimp paste or Plaa Ra and then grilled in a banana leaf. This dish is also known as “Laap Plaa Tong” ( ลาบปลาตอง ), where the banana leaf is included in the name.
ใบตอง
thaiName: แอ็บปลา

description: "Aep Thua Nao" ( แอ็บบถั่วเน่า ) or simply “Thua Nao” ( ถั่วเน่า ) is the name given in northern Thailand to soybeans that are soaked, cooked, wrapped in banana leaves, and then fermented.
thaiName: แอ็บบถั่วเน่า

description: Thai cucumber relish, or "Ajaad Thaeng Gwa" ( อาจาดแตงกวา ) or “Ajaad” for short ( อาจาด ), is often served with fatty curries and meat dishes to give them a fresh flavour. It is made from cucumber, ginger, coriander roots, palm sugar and vinegar.
thaiName: อาจาดแตงกวา

summary: Thai noodle soup with grilled duck
description: The "Ba Mee Bpet Yang" ( บะหมี่เป็ดย่าง ) is a Thai soup with chinese egg noodles and grilled duck. The broth is seasoned with “Saam Gloe”, five-spice powder, light and dark soy sauce, and other ingredients.
thaiName: บะหมี่เป็ดย่าง

summary: Egg Noodles with Red Marinated Meat
description: "Ba Mee Moo Daeng" ( บะหมี่หมูแดง ) is a Thai noodle dish with yellow egg noodles and red marinated pork (Mhu Daeng), which is topped with a sweet, red sauce. Usually the two main ingredients are accompanied by some vegetables and side dishes such as coriander, scallions, fried garlic, or sometimes wontons. Depending on the recipe, this dish can be either a soup or a plate dish.
thaiName: บะหมี่หมูแดง

summary: Egg Noodles With Chicken in Thick Gravy
description: “Ba Mee Rad Na Gai” ( บะหมี่ราดหน้าไก่ ) is a noodle dish made from egg noodles with chicken and mushrooms. Everything is served together in a sauce with yellow bean paste, fish sauce, soy sauce and oyster sauce that has been thickened with cornstarch. Depending on the recipe, it is either more of a plate dish or a soup.
thaiName: บะหมี่ราดหน้าไก่

summary: Noodles With Mushrooms in Thick Gravy
description: “Ba Mee Rad Na Hed” ( บะหมี่ราดหน้าเห็ด ) is a noodle dish with egg noodles and mushrooms. The mushrooms are prepared in a sauce made from broth, yellow bean paste, soy sauce and oyster sauce. This sauce is thickened with cornstarch and then poured over the noodles.
thaiName: บะหมี่ราดหน้าเห็ด

transcription: Ba Mee Rad Na Look Chin
summary: Noodles With Meatballs in Thick Gravy
description: “Ba Mee Rad Na Look Chin” ( บะหมี่ราดหน้าลูกชิ้น ) is a Thai noodle dish where egg noodles are topped with a thickened sauce. This sauce consists of a mixture of broth, yellow bean paste, soy sauce and starch. It includes meatballs that are made from either pork or fish.
alternativeNames: Ba Mee Rad Na Look Chin
Ba Mee Rad Na Luk Chin
Ba Mi Rad Na Luk Chin
Ba Mee Rat Na Luk Chin
thaiName: บะหมี่ราดหน้าลูกชิ้น

summary: Noodles With Pork in Thick Sauce
description: “Ba Mee Rad Na Moo” ( บะหมี่ราดหน้าหมู ) is a Thai noodle dish with egg noodles that are topped with a thickened sauce. The sauce consists of broth, yellow bean paste, different soy sauces and starch. Pork, mushrooms and vegetables serve as ingredients.
thaiName: บะหมี่ราดหน้าหมู

description: Dishes from the book

"Bon Khai Tom" ( ป่นไข่ต้ม ) or simply “Bon Khai” ( ป่นไข่ ) is a very simple dip made from hard-boiled eggs, chili powder, fish sauce, and Plaa Ra. The eggs are pounded in a mortar and then mixed with the seasonings and fresh herbs. This dip is typically served with raw vegetables, pork cracklings, or sticky rice.
thaiName: ป่นไข่ต้ม

description: “Bpet Toon Nam Makham” ( เป็ดตุ๋นน้ำมะขาม ) is a Thai duck stew with tamarind, whose origin presumably lies in Chinese cuisine. For preparation, duck meat is cooked in a broth with soaked shiitake mushrooms and a spice paste made from garlic, coriander roots, white pepper, star anise, and cinnamon. This broth is seasoned with a mixture of fish sauce, light and sweet soy sauce, tamarind paste, and palm sugar.
thaiName: เป็ดตุ๋นน้ำมะขาม

summary: Glutinous Rice Flour Balls in Coconut Milk
description: “Bua Loy” ( บัวลอย ) is a dessert made from colored small rice balls that are cooked in sweetened coconut milk or soy milk. Originally, the balls were colored with natural ingredients, but today food coloring is often used. This dish is also found under the longer name “Bua Loy Ma Prau On” ( บัวลอยมะพร้าวอ่อน ).
thaiName: บัวลอย

description: "Buad Khao Phot" ( บวดข้าวโพด ) refers to sweet corn that is cooked for a short time in sweetened but also slightly salted coconut milk. The name “Buad” ( บวด ) or “Gaeng Buad” ( แกงบวด ) refers to all desserts in which fruit or vegetables are prepared and served in this way.
thaiName: บวดข้าวโพด

description: “Choo Chee Goong” ( ฉู่ฉี่กุ้ง ) is a Thai dish featuring fried prawns in a thick red coconut curry sauce. The sauce has a creamy consistency and a mild spiciness from the curry paste. The name “Choo Chee” is said to come from the sound the curry paste makes when it sizzles in the hot coconut milk.
thaiName: ฉู่ฉี่กุ้ง

description:
"Choo Chee Plaa" ( ฉู่ฉี่ปลา ) is a Thai dish featuring fried or grilled fish served with a thick sauce made from coconut milk and red curry paste. The name “Choo Chee” is said to come from the sound the curry paste makes when it sizzles in the hot coconut milk.
Rezepte
thaiName: ฉู่ฉี่ปลา

description: “Chun Pia” ( ชุนเปี๊ยะ ) is what a type of fried spring rolls wrapped in tofu skin are called in southern Thailand. The filling consists of chopped pork, liver and crab meat and is seasoned with soy sauce, sesame oil, onions, sugar and, depending on the recipe, other ingredients. The dish came to southern Thailand with Chinese immigrants, which explains the Teochew Chinese name of the dish.
thaiName: ชุนเปี๊ยะ

description: Dishes from the book
Dishes from the book

“Dok Gui Chai Pad Moo” ( ดอกกุยช่ายผัดหมู ) involves stir-frying flowering garlic chives together with pork and then deglazing with a mixture of fish sauce, oyster sauce and yellow bean paste. Often pork liver or minced meat is used instead of regular meat in this dish, then the dish is called “Dok Gui Chai Pad Moo Tap” ( ดอกกุยช่ายผัดหมูตับ ) or “Dok Gui Chai Pad Moo Sap” ( ดอกกุยช่ายผัดหหมูสับ ) respectively.
thaiName: ดอกกุยช่ายผัดหมู

transcription: Fak Thong Yad Sai Moo Sap
description: "Fak Thong Yad Sai Moo Sap" ( ฟักทองยัดไส้หมูสับ ) is the name given to a pumpkin that is stuffed with minced pork and then steamed. The minced meat is mixed with red curry paste, fish sauce and various herbs. To make the mixture stick together better, an egg or flour is also mixed in, depending on the recipe.
alternativeNames: Fak Thong Yat Sai Moo Sap
Fak Tong Yat Sai Moo Sap
thaiName: ฟักทองยัดไส้หมูสับ

description: "Foi Thong" ( ฝอยทอง ) is a dessert made from egg yolks, water and fine sugar. The sugar is dissolved in boiling water until a syrup is formed. Beaten egg yolks are then poured into this sweet syrup, creating thin threads.
thaiName: ฝอยทอง

summary: Fruit or Vegetables in Coconut Milk
description:
The name "Gaeng Buad" ( แกงบวด ), which is often simply shortened to “Buad” ( บวด ), describes Thai desserts in which vegetables or fruit are briefly cooked in coconut milk. The coconut milk is sweetened with sugar, but also lightly salted.
These dishes are served both warm and chilled. Depending on the recipe, additional ingredients such as pandan leaves are sometimes added to the coconut milk during cooking.
More Variations “Gaeng Buad Fak Thong” ( แกงบวดฟักทอง ) with pumpkin “Gaeng Buad Gluae” ( แกงบวดกล้วย ) with banana “Gaeng Buad Thua Dam” ( แกงบวดถั่วดำ ) with black beans “Gaeng Buad Pueak” ( แกงบวดเผือก ) with taro
thaiName: แกงบวด

summary: Hearty Curry Made from Plant Juice
description: “Gaeng Buan” ( แกงบวน ) is a very old dish that can be traced back to the 18th century and has its origins in Mon and Khmer cuisine. Pork - in the original recipe also offal - is cooked in a broth that has been colored green with plant juice. Lemongrass leaves, yanang leaves or pumpkin leaves serve as the source for the juice.
thaiName: แกงบวน

summary: Chicken Curry with Turi Tree Blossoms
description: “Gaeng Dok Khae Gai” ( แกงดอกแคไก่ ) is a curry, or rather a soup, from Northern Thailand that is prepared based on a paste made from chilis, garlic, shallots, galangal, lemon and shrimp paste. The filling consists of chicken, bamboo shoots and the blossoms of the turi tree (Dok Khae).
thaiName: แกงดอกแคไก่

description: “Gaeng Gai Gala Ma Prau” ( แกงไก่กะลามะพร้าว ) is a stir-fry dish or rather a dry curry where chicken is stir-fried together with the flesh of a young coconut in curry paste.
thaiName: แกงไก่กะลามะพร้าว

description: “Gaeng Gari Fak Thong” ( แกงกะหรี่ฟักทอง ) is a curry with coconut milk that is prepared based on a yellow curry paste and contains pumpkin. In addition to pumpkin, such a curry is usually prepared with pork or poultry.
thaiName: แกงกะหรี่ฟักทอง

description: “Gaeng Gari Gai” ( แกงกะหรี่ไก่ ) is a curry with coconut milk that is prepared with a yellow curry paste. Chicken and various types of vegetables serve as the main ingredients.
thaiName: แกงกะหรี่ไก่

summary: Yellow Curry with Prawns and Vegetables
description: “Gaeng Gari Goong” ( แกงกะหรี่กุ้ง ) is a curry with coconut milk that is prepared with a yellow curry paste. Prawns and various vegetables serve as the main ingredients.
thaiName: แกงกะหรี่กุ้ง

description:
“Gaeng Gari Moo” ( แกงกะหรี่หมู ) is a coconut milk-based curry with pork, which is prepared with a yellow curry paste. In addition to the pork, the curry often contains vegetables such as potatoes, mini corncobs, tomatoes or Thai eggplants.
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงกะหรี่หมู

description: “Gaeng Gari Moo Sam Chan” ( แกงกะหรี่หมูสามชั้น ) is a yellow curry with coconut milk, whose main ingredient is pork belly. The pork belly is braised in coconut milk for several hours before the curry paste and other ingredients such as fish sauce and palm sugar are added.
thaiName: แกงกะหรี่หมูสามชั้น

description: Gaeng Gari Nuea" แกงกะหรี่เนื้อ is a yellow curry with beef, which is traditionally prepared with potatoes and tomatoes . Depending on the curry paste, the colour of the curry varies between a strong yellow or reddish tones.
thaiName: แกงกะหรี่เนื้อ

description: "Gaeng Hed" ( แกงเห็ด ) is a mushroom soup from Isaan. Various types of mushrooms are cooked in a broth that is based on a paste made from garlic, shallots, chilis and lemongrass. The broth is thickened with yanang extract and seasoned with nam plaa ra as well as various fresh herbs.
thaiName: แกงเห็ด

summary: Curry with Spare Ribs and Mushrooms
description: “Gaeng Hed Si Khrong On” ( แกงเห็ดซี่โครงอ่อน ) is a Northern Thai curry with clear broth that is prepared with spare ribs and mushrooms.
thaiName: แกงเห็ดซี่โครงอ่อน

description: “Gaeng Ho” ( แกงโฮะ ) is a preparation in which the leftovers of various other curry dishes are classically stir-fried together with glass noodles and a variety of other ingredients such as kaffir lime leaves, lemongrass and bamboo shoots. One of the curries used should have been a Gaeng Hang Lae.
thaiName: แกงโฮะ

description:
"Gaeng Hung Lay" ( แกงฮังเล ) is a hearty curry from Northern Thailand. It is usually prepared with fatty pork, spare ribs or pork belly and often contains a large amount of garlic and shallots, but no coconut milk.
The dish originates from neighboring Myanmar, where it is known as “Hin Lay” (ဟင်းလေး). In restaurants with English menus in northern Thai cities like Chiang Mai or Chiang Rai, it is also offered as “Burmese Curry” or “Chiang Mai Curry”.
thaiName: แกงฮังเล

summary: Hearty Curry from Mae Hong Son
description: “Gaeng Hung Lay Tai” ( แกงฮั่งเล่ไต ) is a Shan variation of the well-known Gaeng Hung Lay curry and originates from the northern Thai province of Mae Hong Son. This is also a hearty pork curry with origins in Myanmar, which is not prepared from a pounded curry paste, but from dried, ground herbs and spices. The curry has three characteristic flavors - salty, sour and sweet - with the latter two being much more pronounced than in other variations.
thaiName: แกงฮั่งเล่ไต

transcription: Gaeng Jor Pak Khad Ga Riang
description: “Gaeng Jor Pak Khad Ga Riang” ( แกงจอผักกาดกะเหรี่ยง ) is a Northern Thai soup with choy sum or other mustard greens based on chilis, garlic and thua nao, as prepared by the Karen. The pictured variant has no additional meat addition, but you can also find recipes on the internet with pork belly, ribs or offal.
alternativeNames: Gaeng Dshor Pak Khad Ga Riang
Kaeng Jor Pak Khad Ga Riang
thaiName: แกงจอผักกาดกะเหรี่ยง

description: “Gaeng Jued Fak Thong Moo” ( แกงจืดฟักทองหมู ) is a very simple Northern Thai soup with clear broth, pork and pumpkin. The meat can also be minced meat that has been formed into small dumplings. In Northern Thailand, this soup is probably also simply called “Nam Sup” ( น้ำซุป ).
thaiName: แกงจืดฟักทองหมู

summary: Soup with Chicken and Sweet Leaves
description: “Gaeng Jued Gai Pak Wan” ( แกงจืดไก่ผักหวาน ) is a clear broth soup seasoned with the “three friends” garlic, pepper and coriander root as well as soy and fish sauce. The filling consists of chicken and an herb known as “Pak Wan”.
thaiName: แกงจืดไก่ผักหวาน

summary: Clear Soup with Meatballs and Noodles
description: “Gaeng Jued Look Chin” ( แกงจืดลูกชิ้น ) refers to a soup with clear broth that contains meatballs as well as thin rice or glass noodles. Soups of this type are also found under the name “Gaeng Jued Luk Noa” ( แกงจืดลูกเงาะ ).
thaiName: แกงจืดลูกชิ้น

transcription: Gaeng Jued Tao Hu Moo Sap
summary: Soup with egg tofu and minced meat
description: “Gaeng Jued Tao Hu Moo Sap” ( แกงจืดเต้าหู้หมูสับ ) is a simple soup with clear broth, egg tofu, small minced meatballs and some vegetables. The soup can also be found under the name “Tom Jued Tao Hu Moo Sap” ( ต้มจืดเต้าหู้หมูสับ )
alternativeNames: Gaeng Djued Tao Hu Mhu Sap
Kaeng Jued Tao Hoo Moo Sap
Tom Jued Tao Hu Moo Sap
thaiName: แกงจืดเต้าหู้หมูสับ

summary: Curry With Coconut Milk and Crab
description: “Gaeng Kati Poo Ma” ( แกงกะทิปูม้า ) is a Southern Thai curry with coconut milk and crab. It is based on a “Gaeng Phak Dai” curry paste and is seasoned with palm sugar and fish sauce.
thaiName: แกงกะทิปูม้า

description:
“Gaeng Keow Wan Gai” ( แกงเขียวหวานไก่ ) is a Thai green curry with chicken, which is based on coconut milk. The color comes from the curry paste, which uses fresh green chili peppers. Additional ingredients for this curry are usually different types of vegetables and Thai basil.
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงเขียวหวานไก่

transcription: Gaeng Keow Wan Gai Fak Keaw
summary: Green Curry With Chicken and Winter Melon
description: “Gaeng Keow Wan Gai Fak Keaw” ( แกงเขียวหวานไก่ฟักเขียว ) is a green curry with chicken and winter melon. The winter melon gives the curry an unusual freshness. The dish can also be found under the name “Gaeng Keow Wan Gai Sai Fak” ( แกงเขียวหวานไก่ใส่ฟัก ).
alternativeNames: Gaeng Khiau Wan Gai Fak Khiau
Gaeng Kiew Wan Gai Fak Keaw
Kaeng Kiew Wan Gai Fak Kea
Gaeng Kiew Wan Gai Sai Fak
Gaeng Kiaw Wan Gai Sai Fak
thaiName: แกงเขียวหวานไก่ฟักเขียว

transcription: Gaeng Keow Wan Gunchiang Khai Dao
summary: Green Curry with Chinese Sausage and Fried Eggs
description: “Gaeng Keow Wan Gunchiang Khai Dao” ( แกงเขียวหวานกุนเชียงไข่ดาว ) is a green curry with coconut milk, Chinese gunchiang sausage, and fried eggs.
alternativeNames: Gaeng Khiao Waan Gunchiang Khai Daao
Gaeng Khiao Wan Gunchiang Khai Dao
Kaeng Khiao Wan Gunchiang Khai Dao
thaiName: แกงเขียวหวานกุนเชียงไข่ดาว

transcription: Gaeng Keow Wan Look Chin Plaa
description: “Gaeng Keow Wan Look Chin Plaa” ( แกงเขียวหวานลูกชิ้นปลา ) is a green curry with fish balls from Central Thailand. This is based on green curry paste and is prepared with coconut milk. Depending on the recipe, vegetables are also used in addition to the fish balls. The dish is garnished with Horapa Thai basil and typically served with rice noodles.
alternativeNames: Gaeng Keow Wan Look Chin Plaa
Gaeng Keow Wan Luk Chin Plaa
thaiName: แกงเขียวหวานลูกชิ้นปลา

transcription: Gaeng Keow Wan Look Chin Plaa Pad Haeng
summary: Dry Green Curry with Fish Balls
description: “Gaeng Keow Wan Look Chin Plaa Pad Haeng” ( แกงเขียวหวานลูกชิ้นปลาผัดแห้ง ) is a dry, stir-fried curry with green curry paste and little coconut milk. Fish balls and eggplants are used as ingredients.
alternativeNames: Gaeng Keow Wan Look Chin Plaa Pad Haeng
Gaeng Keow Wan Luk Chin Plaa Pad Haeng
thaiName: แกงเขียวหวานลูกชิ้นปลาผัดแห้ง

description: “Gaeng Keow Wan Moo” ( แกงเขียวหวานหมู ) is the Thai name for green coconut milk curry with pork. In addition to the meat, vegetables such as Thai eggplants, snake beans or wing beans are often used. Another important ingredient is horapa basil, which is stirred into the curry at the end.
thaiName: แกงเขียวหวานหมู

description:
“Gaeng Keow Wan Nuea” ( แกงเขียวหวานเนื้อ ) is the Thai name for green curry with beef. For this aromatic and usually spicy curry, vegetables such as Thai eggplants or green beans are often used in addition to the meat. An important flavor carrier is Thai basil, which is stirred into the curry at the end and steeped briefly, similar to a tea.
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงเขียวหวานเนื้อ

summary: Soup with Wild Betel Pepper Leaf
description: “Gaeng Khae” ( แกงแค ) is a northern Thai soup based on a spice paste with a variety of herbs and a meat component. The name comes from the northern Thai term “Khae” for the wild betel pepper leaf, which is an important ingredient for the dish. Pork or chicken is usually used as meat, but there are also variants with water buffalo, beef, frogs or snails.
thaiName: แกงแค

summary: Chicken Curry with Wild Betel Leaf
description: “Gaeng Khae Gai” ( แกงแคไก่ ) is a northern Thai soup with wild betel pepper leaves and chicken. The broth is prepared based on a paste made from chilies, garlic, shallots, makhwaen, lemongrass and galangal.
thaiName: แกงแคไก่

summary: Soup with Wild Pepper Leaf and Snails
description: “Gaeng Khae Hoi” ( แกงแคหอย ) is a northern Thai soup with wild betel pepper leaves and snails. The broth is based on a paste made from garlic, chilies, shallots, makhwaen, lemongrass and galangal.
thaiName: แกงแคหอย

description: “Gaeng Khanun” ( แกงขนุน ) is a curry from Northern Thailand, in which unripe jackfruit is cooked together with pork spare ribs or pork belly. It is prepared with a simple paste made from dried chili, garlic and shallots as well as shrimp paste or Thua Nao Khaep. After the meat has been cooked until tender, tomatoes and herbs such as Bai Chaplu or Cha Om are added to the curry.
thaiName: แกงขนุน

description:
“Gaeng Khilek” ( แกงขี้เหล็ก ) from central Thailand is a curry with coconut milk, whose main ingredient is the leaves of the cassia tree. These are also called “cassia leaves” and give the curry a bitter note. The curry is prepared with a red curry paste and can contain meat or seafood in addition to the leaves.
In contrast to this curry with coconut milk, there is also a soup with cassia leaves in Isaan that has the same name.
thaiName: แกงขี้เหล็ก

description:
The dish “Gaeng Khilek” ( แกงขี้เหล็ก ) from Isaan is a soup that uses the leaves of the cassia tree, which are also known as “cassia leaves”. These are cooked in yanang extract and water together with beef, buffalo or pork and give the soup a unique flavor.
Even though it has the same name, the Gaeng Khilek from Isaan is a completely different dish from the Gaeng Khilek with coconut milk that is known in other regions of Thailand.
thaiName: แกงขี้เหล็ก (อีสาน)

transcription: Gaeng Khua Poo Bai Cha Plu
summary: Crab Curry with Wild Betel Pepper Leaves
description:
“Gaeng Khua Poo Bai Cha Plu” ( แกงคั่วปูใบชะพลู ), or simply “Gaeng Poo Bai Cha Plu” ( แกงปูใบชะพลู ), is a Southern Thai curry dish with crab meat and wild betel pepper leaves. The curry is prepared with coconut milk and is based on a Khua curry paste made from turmeric, black pepper, dried chilies, shallots, garlic, and shrimp paste, among other ingredients.
The wild betel pepper leaves give the dish a slightly bitter aroma and a distinctive flavor note. Traditionally, the curry is served with thin rice noodles.
thaiName: แกงคั่วปูใบชะพลู

description: The “Gaeng Khua Prai Gai Baan” ( แกงคั่วไพรไก่บ้าน ) is a dry curry that is prepared in a wok. Here chicken is stir-fried in red curry paste and various herbs. The dish can also be found under the name “Gaeng Khua Gai Baan” ( แกงคั่วไก่บ้าน ).
thaiName: แกงคั่วไพรไก่บ้าน

transcription: Gaeng Khua Prik Si Khrong Moo
description: “Gaeng Khua Prik Si Khrong Moo” ( แกงคั่วพริกซี่โครงหมู ) is a southern Thai curry where pork spare ribs are fried with southern Thai curry paste and then braised in water or broth.
alternativeNames: Gaeng Khua Prik Si Krong Mhu
Kaeng Kua Prik Si Krong Moo
thaiName: แกงคั่วพริกซี่โครงหมู

description: “Gaeng Khua Sapparot Gai” ( แกงคั่วสับปะรดไก่ ) is a spicy curry based on a special curry paste, prepared with chicken and pineapple.
thaiName: แกงคั่วสับปะรดไก่

description: “Gaeng Khua Sapparot Hoi” ( แกงคั่วสับปะรดหอย ) is a curry based on a special red curry paste, prepared with mussels and pineapple. The dish can also be found under the longer name “Gaeng Khua Sapparot Sai Hoi Malaeng Phu” ( แกงคั่วสับปะรดใส่หอยแมลงภู่ ), in which case it is prepared with blue mussels.
thaiName: แกงคั่วสับปะรดหอย

description:
“Gaeng Lao Ubon Ratchathani” ( แกงลาวอุบลราชธานี ) is a soup with pork belly or ribs and mustard greens from the province Ubon Ratchathani or short “Ubon” in Isaan. This dish is based on a paste made from chilies, galangal, lemongrass as well as shallots and garlic. It is seasoned with Nam Plaa Ra and garnished with dill, both hints of a Lao origin of the dish.
The soup can also be found under the name “Gaeng Lao Mhu” ( แกงลาวหมู ) and ultimately seems to be a variation of Gaeng Om.
thaiName: แกงลาวอุบลราชธานี

description: “Gaeng Liang Ga Prau” ( แกงเลียงกะเพรา ) is a simple, clear soup prepared on the basis of a paste made from shallots, garlic, pepper and shrimp paste. The soup is filled with grilled fish and banana blossom cut into strips. The soup is garnished with holy basil (Ga Prau), which gives the soup its name.
thaiName: แกงเลียงกะเพรา

transcription: Gaeng Liang Tam Lueng Sai Khai
summary: Soup with Ivy Gourd Leaves and Egg
description: “Gaeng Liang Tam Lueng Sai Khai” ( แกงเลียงตำลึงใส่ไข่ ) is a simple soup based on a paste made from dried shrimp, white pepper, shallots, finger root, chilies and shrimp paste. Ivy gourd or spinach leaves as well as beaten eggs serve as fillings. The dish can also be found under the name “Gaeng Liang Khai Sai Tam Lueng” ( แกงเลียงไข่ใส่ตำลึง ).
alternativeNames: Kaeng Liang Tam Lueng Sai Khai
Gaeng Liang Khai Sai Tam Lueng
thaiName: แกงเลียงตำลึงใส่ไข่

description: Gaeng Massaman Gae ( แกงมัสมั่นแกะ ) is a curry with coconut milk based on a Massaman curry paste, which is prepared with lamb. If it is prepared with leg of lamb, it is also called Gaeng Massaman Nong Gae ( แกงมัสมั่นน่องแกะ ).
thaiName: แกงมัสมั่นแกะ

description:
Gaeng massaman gai ( แกงมัสมั่นไก่ ) is a southern Thai curry with coconut milk. It is based on a paste with aromatic spices such as cinnamon, cardamom and star anise. These give the curry a warm and aromatic flavor composition. In addition to the chicken, potatoes and sweet potatoes are also used as ingredients.
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงมัสมั่นไก่

description: Gaeng Massaman Man Thet ( แกงมัสมั่นมันเทศ ) is a variation of the southern Thai Massaman curry, in which only sweet potatoes are used as an ingredient.
thaiName: แกงมัสมั่นมันเทศ

description: “Gaeng Massaman Mhu” ( แกงมัสมั่นหมู ) is a coconut milk curry based on a massaman curry paste with pork and potatoes. Massaman curry originally comes from the Muslim south of the country and would probably never be prepared with pork there. However, as this curry is now very popular throughout Thailand, there are now also variations with pork.
thaiName: แกงมัสมั่นหมู

description:
“Gaeng Massaman Nuea” ( แกงมัสมั่นเนื้อ ) is a southern Thai curry with coconut milk. It is based on an aromatic paste made from spices such as cinnamon, cardamom and star anise, which give the curry a warm, aromatic flavor. In addition to the beef , potatoes or sweet potatoes and roasted peanuts are also used as a garnish.
HistoryIn the following video from OTR you can learn a bit about the supposed origin and history of this dish.
thaiName: แกงมัสมั่นเนื้อ

description: “Gaeng Moo Chamuang” ( แกงหมูชะมวง ) is a simple curry with pork and sour chamuang leaves. This is prepared with red curry paste as a base, but without coconut milk.
thaiName: แกงหมูชะมวง

summary: Curry with Pork and Cardamom Shoots
description: “Gaeng Moo Nor Krawan” ( แกงหมูหน่อกระวาน ) is a southern Thai curry with pork and cardamom shoots. It is prepared with a “Gaeng Pak Tai” curry paste and coconut milk. As a substitute for the cardamom shoots, thin ginger slices can also be used.
thaiName: แกงหมูหน่อกระวาน

summary: Soup with Yanang and Bamboo Shoots
description: “Gaeng Normai” ( แกงหน่อไม้ ) is a Thai soup with Lao origins that is based on a broth made from yanang extract. It contains the eponymous bamboo shoots, pork belly, potatoes, various types of mushrooms, wing beans and lemongrass. The broth is seasoned with fish sauce and plaa ra and thickened with glutinous rice flour.
thaiName: แกงหน่อไม้

description: Gaeng Om Moo ( แกงอ่อมหมู ) is a fairly clear soup from northeastern Thailand. The filling consists of pork and Thai aubergines or other vegetables such as pumpkin. The soup is based on a paste made from garlic, chilis, shallots and lemongrass. It is spicier than the northern Thai variant of Gaeng Om and is more similar to the Laotian stew Or Lam, but is somewhat thinner than this because only a little Khao Khua is used for thickening. To distinguish it from the northern Thai variant, the dish could also be called “Gaeng Om Moo Isaan” ( แกงอ่อมหมูอีสาน ).
thaiName: แกงอ่อมหมู (อีสาน)

description: “Gaeng Om Nuea” ( แกงอ่อมเนื้อ ) is a Northern Thai soup or curry with clear broth and beef or buffalo meat as well as fresh herbs. The soup is based on a paste made from chilis, garlic, shallots, lemongrass, galangal and makhwaen or Sichuan pepper. To distinguish it from the similarly named “Gaeng Om” from Isaan, the dish could also be called “Gaeng Om Nuea Lanna”.
thaiName: แกงอ่อมเนื้อ (ล้านนา)

description:
“Gaeng Paa” ( แกงป่า ) is a curry without coconut milk that is traditionally prepared in the rural areas of northern and northeastern Thailand. It is based on a spicy curry paste and is usually prepared with meat or fish as well as various vegetables and herbs.
Originally, it was probably prepared with everything the forest or jungle had to offer, which is probably where the name “Jungle Curry” comes from, although “Paa” can actually be better translated as “forest.” Wild game was often used as the meat component, and the large amount of herbs could have helped neutralize an overly intense game flavor.
thaiName: แกงป่า

description: “Gaeng Paa Mhu Paa” ( แกงป่าหมู ) is a northern Thai curry with pork. It is prepared with a special red curry paste and clear broth. Other ingredients include various vegetables and spices, such as baby corn, Thai eggplants, Thai chilies, green pepper, krachai and holy basil.
thaiName: แกงป่าหมู

description: “Gaeng Paa Moo Paa” ( แกงป่าหมูป่า ) is a northern Thai curry with wild boar (Moo Paa) as the main protein source. It is characterized by the use of a special red curry paste and is prepared without coconut milk. Various vegetables and herbs are also used as additional ingredients, which can vary regionally and seasonally.
thaiName: แกงป่าหมูป่า

description: “Gaeng Paa Moo Samun Prai” ( แกงป่าหมูสมุนไพร ) is a Thai curry with pork, vegetables and herbs. The ingredients include snake beans, mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, long coriander and acacia shoots, which are cooked together with a special red curry paste and various spices in broth. The curry is served with sticky rice or jasmine rice.
thaiName: แกงป่าหมูสมุนไพร

description: “Gaeng Paa Nuea” ( แกงป่าเนื้อ ) is a northern Thai curry with beef. It is prepared based on a curry paste, but made with broth and not with coconut milk. In addition to the beef, various types of vegetables such as baby corn, eggplants and snake beans are used. The curry is seasoned with fish sauce, some sugar, fingerroot, green pepper, kaffir lime leaves, khao khua as well as holy basil.
thaiName: แกงป่าเนื้อ

summary: Jungle Curry With Beef and Fingerroot
description: “Gaeng Paa Nuea Khorat” ( แกงป่าเนื้อโคราช ) is a Thai curry dish from Nakhon Ratchasima province or short “Khorat”, that is prepared without coconut milk. It consists mainly of beef and fingerroot. Both are braised in a spicy broth based on a red curry paste with coriander roots, Thai chilis, garlic, fish sauce and tamarind paste. The dish is served with jasmine or sticky rice.
thaiName: แกงป่าเนื้อโคราช

description:
Gaeng panaeng gai ( แกงพะแนงไก่ ) is a southern Thai curry dish with chicken. It is prepared with a panaeng curry paste and coconut milk. Kaffir lime leaves and peanuts are often added to give the curry a special aromatic note.
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงพะแนงไก่

description: Gaeng Panaeng Moo ( แกงพะแนงหมู ) is a thick curry with coconut milk that is made on the basis of a paste consisting of dried chilis, kaffir lime leaves and peanuts, among other things. Pork is used as the filling here. Depending on the recipe, pea aubergines, mild chilis or roasted peanuts are also added to the curry.
thaiName: แกงพะแนงหมู

description:
Gaeng Panaeng Nuea" ( แกงพะแนงเนื้อ ) is a thick curry with coconut milk, which is made from a paste that consists of dried chilies, kaffir lime leaves and peanuts, among other things. Beef is used as the main ingredient. Depending on the recipe, pea eggplants, mild chilies or roasted peanuts are also added. The curry is often garnished with finely chopped kaffir lime leaves.
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงพะแนงเนื้อ

description: Gaeng Panaeng Tao Hu ( แกงพะแนงเต้าหู้ ) is a vegetarian variant of the well-known Panaeng curry, in which tofu is used as the filling. By using vegan fish sauce and a curry paste without shrimp paste, this dish can be prepared completely vegan.
thaiName: แกงพะแนงเต้าหู้

summary: Red curry with grilled duck breast
description:
Gaeng Phed Bpet" ( แกงเผ็ดเป็ด ) is a curry made with a red curry paste and coconut milk. The garnish is grilled duck and various vegetables. The dish can also be found as “Gaeng Phed Bpet Yang” ( แกงเผ็ดเป็ดย่าง ) or “Gaeng Daeng Bpet” ( แกงแดงเป็ด ).
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดเป็ด

summary: Curry with grilled duck breast and lychees
description: Gaeng Phed Bpet Yang Linchee" ( แกงเผ็ดเป็ดย่างลิ้นจี่ ) is a red curry with coconut milk, which is prepared with grilled duck, lychees and often other fruit and vegetables such as pineapple or Thai eggplants.
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดเป็ดย่างลิ้นจี่

description: “Gaeng Phed Fak Thong” ( แกงเผ็ดฟักทอง ) is a curry with coconut milk, red curry paste and pumpkin. Chicken or pork is usually added as an additional ingredient, but the curry can also be prepared completely vegetarian. The dish can also be found under the name “Gaeng Deang Fak Thong” ( แกงแดงฟักทอง ).
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดฟักทอง

summary: Red Curry with Pumpkin and Chicken
description: “Gaeng Phed Fak Thong Gai” ( แกงเผ็ดฟักทองไก่ ) is a curry with coconut milk based on red curry paste. Pumpkin and chicken are used as ingredients. The dish can also be found under the shortened name “Gaeng Phed Fak Thong” ( แกงเผ็ดฟักทอง ) or as “Gaeng Deang Fak Thong Gai” ( แกงแดงฟักทองไก่ ).
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดฟักทองไก่

summary: Red Curry with Pumpkin and Pork
description: “Gaeng Phed Fak Thong Moo” ( แกงเผ็ดฟักทองหมู ) is a Thai curry with red curry paste, coconut milk, pumpkin and pork. This curry is also known by the names “Gaeng Phed Fak Thong” ( แกงเผ็ดฟักทอง ) or “Gaeng Deang Fak Thong Moo” ( แกงแดงฟักทองหมู ).
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดฟักทองหมู

description:
"Gaeng Phed Gai" ( แกงเผ็ดไก่ ) is a Thai curry with coconut milk, which is prepared with a red curry paste. Poultry and various vegetables such as snake beans, mini corn cobs or Thai eggplants are used as additional ingredients. The dish is also known as “Gaeng Daeng Gai” ( แกงแดงไก่ ).
Rezepte
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดไก่

summary: Red Curry With Chicken and Winter Melon
description: “Gaeng Phed Gai Fak Keaw” ( แกงเผ็ดไก่ฟักเขียว ) is a red curry with coconut milk where chicken and winter melon are used as ingredients.
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดไก่ฟักเขียว

summary: Red curry with chicken and potatoes
description: Gaeng Phed Gai Man Farang ( แกงเผ็ดไก่มันฝรั่ง ) is a red Thai curry with coconut milk, prepared with chicken and potatoes.
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดไก่มันฝรั่ง

description: “Gaeng Phed Moo” ( แกงเผ็ดหมู ) or “Gaeng Daeng Moo” ( แกงแดงหมู ) is a Thai curry with coconut milk based on red curry paste. It features pork and various types of vegetables.
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดหมู

description: “Gaeng Phed Moo Sap” ( แกงเผ็ดหมูสับ ) is a red Thai curry with minced pork. It is prepared using red curry paste and coconut milk. The curry typically also contains vegetables such as Thai eggplant, yard long beans, or tomatoes. The dish is also known as “Gaeng Daeng Moo Sap” ( แกงแดงหมูสับ ).
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดหมูสับ

description: Gaeng Phed Nuea" ( แกงเผ็ดเนื้อ ) is a curry with coconut milk based on a red curry paste, which is prepared with beef. In addition to the meat, various vegetables are usually used as a garnish. Such curries are also known as “Gaeng Daeng Nuea” ( แกงแดงเนื้อ ).
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดเนื้อ

description: “Gaeng Phed Pik Gai” ( แกงเผ็ดปีกไก่ ) is a curry without coconut milk from Isaan. Chopped chicken wings are braised in a spicy broth made from red curry paste, chilis, galangal, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves until tender. Thai eggplants are used as vegetables.
thaiName: แกงเผ็ดปีกไก่

summary: Curry with Fermented Fish and Bamboo Shoots
description: “Gaeng Plaa Ra Normai” ( แกงปลาร้าหน่อไม้ ) is a Thai curry with coconut milk. It is filled with pork, dried fish and bamboo shoots. The broth is based on a paste made from lemongrass, garlic, shallots, galangal, fingerroot and shrimp paste. The curry is seasoned with fermented fish sauce, palm sugar, kaffir lime leaves and fresh chilies. This dish can also be found under the name “Moo Tom Plaa Ra Normai” ( หมูต้มปลาร้าหน่อไม้ ).
thaiName: แกงปลาร้าหน่อไม้

description: The super spicy southern Thai chicken curry “Gaeng Prik Gai” ( แกงพริกไก่ ) is based on a “Pak Tai” curry paste. No coconut milk is used and galangal as well as kaffir lime leaves are used for seasoning.
thaiName: แกงพริกไก่

summary: Curry with Meat and Shrimp Paste
description: The origin of Gaeng Ran Juan ( แกงรัญจวนหมู ) probably lies at the court of the Thai king, where it was a popular leftover dish. Leftover meat was simmered again together with a seasoning paste based on lots of shrimp paste and fresh herbs such as lemongrass and Thai basil. Traditionally the dish was prepared with beef, but today the dish can also be found with pork. The name “Gaeng Ran Juan” can be translated as “curry that one yearns for”.
thaiName: แกงรัญจวนหมู

description: "Gaeng Sap Nok" ( แกงสับนก ) is a red curry originally prepared in rural regions of central Thailand with small rice field birds, whose meat was chopped together with the bones before being added to the curry. In cities, minced chicken is now used as a substitute, which is why the curry is also found under the name “Gaeng Sap Nok Gai” ( แกงสับนกไก่ ). Other common ingredients are yard long beans, pea eggplants, and young ginger.
thaiName: แกงสับนก

summary: Sour and Spicy Curry with Prawns
description: “Gaeng Som Goong” ( แกงส้มกุ้ง ) is a sour and spicy Thai curry with prawns. The curry is prepared with a paste made from tamarind, chilis, fingerroot and other ingredients. Usually various vegetables are cooked along with it, which can absorb the liquid well, such as lotus stems or taro stems.
thaiName: แกงส้มกุ้ง

transcription: Gaeng Som Goong Khai Cha Om
summary: Sour and Spicy Curry with Prawns and Acacia Leaf Omelet
description: “Gaeng Som Goong Khai Cha Om” ( แกงส้มกุ้งไข่ชะอม ) is a sour and spicy curry from central Thailand that is prepared with prawns and omelet with acacia leaves. The omelet is fried separately, then cut into pieces and added to the finished soup. This dish is also known as “Gaeng Som Goong Cha Om Khai Thod” ( แกงส้มกุ้งชะอมไข่ทอด ) or “Gaeng Som Cha Om Khai Sai Goong” ( แกงส้มชะอมไข่ใส่กุ้ง ).
alternativeNames: Gaeng Som Goong Kai Cha Om
Gaeng Som Goong Khai Cha Om
Kaeng Som Goong Khai Cha Om
Gaeng Som Goong Cha Om Khai Thod
Gaeng Som Cha Om Khai Sai Goong
thaiName: แกงส้มกุ้งไข่ชะอม

summary: Sour and Spicy Curry with Fish
description: “Gaeng Som Pak Tai Plaa” ( แกงส้มปักษ์ใต้ปลา ) is a southern Thai sour curry with fish. The curry is based on a paste made from tamarind, chilis and other ingredients. Often various vegetables are cooked in a Gaeng Som as well, such as lotus stems or taro stems, which are able to absorb a lot of liquid.
thaiName: แกงส้มปักษ์ใต้ปลา

description: “Gaeng Som Plaa” ( แกงส้มปลา ) is a sour curry with fish that is prepared on the basis of a Gaeng Som curry paste and without coconut milk. The fish is often accompanied by various types of vegetables. This reddish curry originally comes from Central Thailand and should not be confused with Southern Thai Gaeng Som Pak Tai Plaa, although both are very popular in Southern Thailand.
thaiName: แกงส้มปลา

description:
“Gaeng Taepo” ( แกงเทโพ ) is a red coconut milk curry that is typically prepared with water spinach and pork belly or fish. The special feature of this curry is the use of kaffir limes or their juice, which gives the curry a rather sour note.
Depending on the recipe, tamarind paste is also added along with the kaffir limes. There are also recipes that use only tamarind paste as the source of the sour flavor.
The name of the curry comes from the traditionally used freshwater fish, the slender catfish (Pangasius larnaudii), which is called “Plaa Taepo” ( ปลาเทโพ ) in Thai. However, this fish has such a strong aroma that it is not often used nowadays.
thaiName: แกงเทโพ

summary: Curry with Meat and Glass Noodles
description: “Gaeng Woon Sen” ( แกงวุ้นเส้น ) is a curry or rather a soup that is made on the basis of a simple paste from chilis, garlic, lemongrass and galangal. Glass noodles serve as the main ingredient, which are usually accompanied by chicken or pork as well as various vegetables.
thaiName: แกงวุ้นเส้น

description:
“Gai Baan Thod Gluea” ( ไก่บ้านทอดเกลือ ) is a dish from northern Thailand where chicken pieces are marinated in a mixture of garlic, pepper, soy sauce, salt and other spices and then deep-fried. In the simplest case, the meat is simply rubbed with salt before frying.
In both variants, the meat becomes crispy on the outside and remains juicy on the inside. The marinade provides an intense flavour. The whole dish is usually served with a spicy dip and sticky rice. This dish is also known as “Gai Baan Thod Khem” ( ไก่บ้านทอดเค็ม ) or “Gai Mueang Khua Gluea” ( ไก่เมืองคั่วเกลือ ).
thaiName: ไก่บ้านทอดเกลือ

description:
“Gai Hor Bai Toey” ( ไก่ห่อใบเตย ) consists of marinated chicken that is wrapped in pandan leaves. These pandan packets are then grilled or deep-fried, where the meat absorbs not only the flavors of the marinade but also those of the leaves. The dish can also be found under the shortened name “Gai Bai Toey” ( ไก่ใบเตย ).
The dish was first served in the 1980s in a then very famous restaurant, the “Djit Pochana” ( จิตรโภชนา ) in Bangkok. It was so popular that countless restaurants in the city copied it and “Gai Hor Bai Toey” eventually spread to Thai restaurants around the world.
thaiName: ไก่ห่อใบเตย

summary: Chicken with Ginger and Soy Sauce
description: “Gai Khem” ( ไก่เค็ม ) is a wok dish traditionally prepared by Chinese-Thai people using leftover chicken that was sacrificed at celebrations such as Chinese New Year or the “Ching Ming Festival”. The meat is stir-fried with a paste made from garlic, ginger and pepper and deglazed with light and dark soy sauce.
thaiName: ไก่เค็ม

description:
“Gai Khua Samun Prai” ( ไก่คั่วสมุนไพร ) is a dry curry with chicken that is prepared with a paste made from dried chilis, lemongrass, turmeric and salt. The chicken is seared at high heat before being mixed with the paste, fish sauce, oyster sauce and fresh herbs such as kaffir lime leaves and Thai basil.
The name of the dish consists of three parts: “Gai”, which means chicken, “Khua”, which can be translated as “stir-fry” or “roast” and “Samun Prai”, which means something like “herbs”. The dish can also be found under the reversed designation “Khua Gai Samun Prai” ( คั่วไก่สมุนไพร ).
thaiName: ไก่คั่วสมุนไพร

summary: Fried Chicken with Wild Betel Leaves
description: “Gai Pad Bai Cha Plu” ( ไก่ผัดใบชะพลู ) is a stir-fry dish made with chicken that is cooked together with garlic and chilis. The chicken is then mixed with wild betel leaves that have been cut into strips and deglazed with fish and soy sauce. Depending on the recipe, the chicken can also be mixed with red curry paste during cooking. The dish is also known by the shortened name “Gai Pad Cha Plu” ( ไก่ผัดชะพลู ).
thaiName: ไก่ผัดใบชะพลู

summary: Fried Chicken with Garlic and Pepper
description: Gai Pad Gratiam Prik Thai ( ไก่ผัดกระเทียมพริกไทย ) is a simple wok dish in which marinated chicken is stir-fried together with pepper and fried garlic. The finished dish is then served with jasmine rice.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดกระเทียมพริกไทย

description: Gai Pad Hed" ( ไก่ผัดเห็ด ) is a stir-fry made from chicken and various mushrooms. Both ingredients are stir-fried together with garlic and chilis. Everything is then deglazed with a mixture of soya sauce, fish sauce and oyster sauce.Depending on the recipe, the sauce may also contain yellow bean paste.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดเห็ด

description: “Gai Pad Kha” ( ไก่ผัดข่า ) is a southern Thai stir-fried dish in which chicken is sautéed with garlic, chilis and thin slices of galangal. The whole thing is deglazed with a mixture of oyster sauce, fish sauce and soya sauce. Depending on the recipe, the chilis and garlic can be made into a paste beforehand and turmeric added as an additional spice.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดข่า

description: “Gai Pad Kha Yu” ( ไก่ผัดกาหยู ) is another name for the well-known cashew dish Gai Pad Met Ma Muang. “Kha Yu” ( กาหยู ) is probably a colloquial term for cashew nuts commonly used in southern Thailand.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดกาหยู

description: “Gai Pad Khao Phot On” ( ไก่ผัดข้าวโพดอ่อน ) is a simple dish where chicken meat is stir-fried together with baby corn. For this, the meat is first stir-fried together with garlic before chopped baby corn cobs are added. All this is then deglazed with a mixture of oyster sauce, fish sauce and soy sauce. The dish can also be found under the name “Gai Pad Jot Khao Pot” ( ไก่ผัดยอดข้าวโพด ).
thaiName: ไก่ผัดข้าวโพดอ่อน

description: “Gai Pad Khing” ( ไก่ผัดขิง ) is a quick stir-fry dish in which chicken is fried with ginger, mu-err mushrooms and chilli peppers and then deglazed with a mixture of soy sauce, yellow bean paste and white pepper.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดขิง

summary: Fried Chicken with Ginger and Basil
description: “Gai Pad Khing Ga Prau” ( ไก่ผัดขิงกะเพรา ) is the name for a simple wok dish with chicken, ginger and holy basil. The meat and ginger are stir-fried together with garlic, then deglazed with a mixture of oyster sauce, fish sauce and soy sauce, and finally mixed with holy basil.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดขิงกะเพรา

description: “Gai Pad Met Ma Muan” ( ไก่ผัดเม็ดมะม่วง ) or with the full name “Gai Pad Met Ma Muang Himaphan” ( ไก่ผัดเม็ดมะม่วงหิมพานต์ ) is a wok dish in which chicken is sautéed with vegetables and cashew nuts.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดเม็ดมะม่วง

description: “Gai Pad Nam Man Hoi” ( ไก่ผัดน้ำมันหอย ) refers to a simple wok dish with chicken. The meat is stir-fried and then briefly cooked in thickened oyster sauce. The dish can also be found under the shortened name “Gai Nam Man Hoi” ( ไก่น้ำมันหอย ).
thaiName: ไก่ผัดน้ำมันหอย

description: “Gai Pad Nam Man Nga” ( ไก่ผัดน้ำมันงา ) is chicken stir-fried together with plenty of garlic and then deglazed with a mixture of sesame oil, light soy sauce, and dark soy sauce. The resulting sauce is typically thickened with a bit of cornstarch.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดน้ำมันงา

description: “Gai Pad Nam Prik Pao” ( ไก่ผัดน้ำพริกเผา ) is a Thai stir-fry dish where chicken is fried in chilli paste and deglazed with a mixture of various sauces. Depending on the recipe, the meat is first breaded and deep-fried. There are variations where fresh vegetables are mixed with the meat or where Thai basil is simply mixed in at the end. The dish is sometimes also called “Gai Pad Prik Pao” ( ไก่ผัดพริกเผา ).
thaiName: ไก่ผัดน้ำพริกเผา

summary: Stir-Fried Chicken with White Sesame Seeds
description:
“Gai Pad Nga Khao” ( ไก่ผัดงาขาว ) is a Chinese-Thai stir-fried dish. Chicken is stir-fried together with garlic and ginger. The meat is then deglazed with a mixture of soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar, and finally combined with roasted white sesame seeds.
Depending on the recipe, the dish can also be prepared with various vegetables such as Chinese broccoli or baby corn. The dish is also known by the shortened name “Gai Pad Nga” ( ไก่ผัดงา ).
thaiName: ไก่ผัดงาขาว

description: “Gai Pad Normai” ( ไก่ผัดหน่อไม้ ) is a simple stir-fry dish where chicken is stir-fried together with bamboo shoots. First, the meat is stir-fried with garlic, then the bamboo shoots are added. Everything is finished with a mixture of oyster sauce, fish sauce, light soy sauce and a little palm sugar. Additionally, the dish can contain various other ingredients, such as vegetables, Thai basil and spring onions, depending on the recipe.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดหน่อไม้

description: “Gai Pad Normai Farang” ( ไก่ผัดหน่อไม้ฝรั่ง ) is a simple wok dish with chicken and green asparagus. Both are stir-fried with garlic and then deglazed with a mixture of oyster sauce, soy sauce and fish sauce.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดหน่อไม้ฝรั่ง

description: “Gai Pad Pak Choi” ( ไก่ผัดผักฉ่อย ) is a simple wok dish with chicken and bok choy. Both are stir-fried together with garlic and then finished with a mixture of soy sauce, fish sauce and oyster sauce.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดผักฉ่อย

description: "Gai Pad Pak Ruam Mit" ( ไก่ผัดผักรวมมิตร ) or shortened “Gai Pad Pak Ruam” ( ไก่ผัดผักรวม ) is a Thai stir-fry dish made from fried chicken and colorful vegetables. The ingredients are stir-fried with garlic and then deglazed with a sauce made from oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, and palm sugar. The dish is also known by the names “Pad Pak Gai” ( ผัดผักไก่ ) or “Pad Pak Ruam Sai Gai” ( ผัดผักรวมใส่ไก่ ).
thaiName: ไก่ผัดผักรวมมิตร

summary: Stir-Fried Chicken with Yellow Bean Paste
description: “Gai Pad Tao Jiaw” ( ไก่ผัดเต้าเจี้ยว ) is a stir-fry dish where chicken is stir-fried together with garlic and yellow bean paste. The dish is then finished with a mixture of oyster sauce, fish sauce and soy sauce. Often mushrooms and fresh vegetables are also used. In principle, it’s similar to Rad Na, just with much less sauce and rice as a side dish.
thaiName: ไก่ผัดเต้าเจี้ยว

description: “Gai Ping” ( ไก่ปิ้ง ) are chicken skewers that are grilled over an open fire. The meat pieces are marinated beforehand in a marinade of coriander roots, black pepper, soy sauce, oyster sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ไก่ปิ้ง

description:
"Gai Saam Yang" ( ไก่สามอย่าง ) is not a chicken dish, as the literal translation “three times grilled chicken” might suggest, but rather a simple yet popular snack. For this, ingredients such as roasted peanuts, fresh ginger, lime pieces, chilis, shallots and dried shrimp are arranged on a plate.
The idea is to combine these different ingredients with their different flavors spoonful by spoonful so that new flavor explosions are constantly created. In this respect, it is comparable to the popular snack Miang Kham, where the composition of ingredients is very similar.
thaiName: ไก่สามอย่าง

description: “Gai Satay” ( ไก่สะเต๊ะ ) or “Satay Gai” ( สะเต๊ะไก่ ) is the name given to chicken skewers that are marinated and grilled. The chicken meat is marinated in coconut milk, turmeric and various other spices before being placed on skewers and grilled over open flame. These skewers are typically served with a peanut dip and the cucumber dip “ajaad”.
thaiName: ไก่สะเต๊ะ

description:
“Gai Tai Nam” ( ไก่ใต้น้ำ ) is a whole chicken that is braised in a marinade of pepper, galangal, lemongrass, dried chilis, shallots, garlic and soy sauce until it is very tender. What makes this dish special is the cooking method, because a bowl of ice-cold water is placed on top of the pot. The resulting condensation of the cooking vapors means that the chicken literally braises in its own juices and absorbs the flavors of the marinade.
This unusual method also gives the dish its name, which can be translated as “chicken under water”. The dish is also sometimes called “Gai Ba Dan” ( ไก่บาดาล ), which means “chicken under the earth”.
thaiName: ไก่ใต้น้ำ

description: In the dish called “Gai Thakrai” ( ไก่ตะไคร้ ), cut chicken thighs are deep-fried golden brown and then mixed with also deep-fried lemongrass.
thaiName: ไก่ตะไคร้

description: “Gai Thod Gratiam Grob” ( ไก่ทอดกระเทียมกรอบ ) refers to fried chicken pieces such as drumsticks or wings that are served together with crispy fried garlic. The meat is marinated before preparation in a marinade of garlic, coriander roots, pepper as well as some oil and fish sauce.
thaiName: ไก่ทอดกระเทียมกรอบ

summary: Deep-Fried Chicken with Garlic and Pepper
description: “Gai Thod Gratiam Prik Thai” ( ไก่ทอดกระเทียมพริกไทย ) refers to chicken meat or chicken pieces that are marinated in a mixture of garlic and pepper and then deep-fried.
thaiName: ไก่ทอดกระเทียมพริกไทย

description: The street food snack “Gai Thod Hat Yai” ( ไก่ทอดหาดใหญ่ ) from the southern Thai city of Hat Yai features chicken drumsticks marinated in a mixture of cilantro roots, garlic, pepper, sugar, and fish sauce before being coated in rice flour and deep-fried. What makes this dish special are the fried shallots that are sprinkled over the drumsticks before serving.
thaiName: ไก่ทอดหาดใหญ่

description: “Gai Thod Makhwaen” ( ไก่ทอดมะแขว่น ) refers to deep-fried chicken pieces that are marinated with the Northern Thai spice makhwaen, salt and some fish sauce.
thaiName: ไก่ทอดมะแขว่น

summary: Fried Chicken Drumsticks with Fish Sauce
description: “Gai Thod Nam Pla” ( ไก่ทอดน้ำปลา ) are deep-fried chicken drumsticks. Before frying, they are marinated with fish sauce, coriander roots, garlic and pepper, then dusted with starch.
thaiName: ไก่ทอดน้ำปลา

summary: Deep-Fried Chicken with Nam Prik Pao
description: For “Gai Thod Nam Prik Pao” ( ไก่ทอดน้ำพริกเผา ), chicken is marinated with Saam Gler and oyster sauce, then deep-fried and finally stir-fried together with Nam Prik Pao.
alternativeNames: Gai Tod Pad Nam Prik Pao
thaiName: ไก่ทอดน้ำพริกเผา

description: "Gai Tom Kha Min" ( ไก่ต้มขมิ้น ) is a chicken soup from southern Thailand. The chicken is cooked in a broth with fresh turmeric root, lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. Tamarind paste provides a slight sourness. The soup is typically served with jasmine rice.
thaiName: ไก่ต้มขมิ้น

summary: Chicken Soup with Winter Melon and Pickled Lime
description: “Gai Toon Fak Manao Dong” ( ไก่ตุ๋นฟักมะนาวดอง ) is a sour-bitter chicken soup that is seasoned with pickled limes, salt, crushed coriander roots and soy sauce. Winter melon is used as vegetable. This soup can also be found under the names “Gai Tom Fak Manao Dong” ( ไก่ต้มฟักมะนาวดอง ) or “Tom Fak Gai Toon Manao Dong” ( ต้มฟักไก่ตุ๋นมะนาวดอง ).
alternativeNames: Tom Fak Gai Toon Manao Dong
thaiName: ไก่ตุ๋นฟักมะนาวดอง

transcription: Gai Toon Tao Jiaw Man Farang
description: “Gai Toon Tao Jiaw Man Farang” ( ไก่ตุ๋นเต้าเจี้ยวมันฝรั่ง ) is a dish where chicken is braised in a sauce with yellow bean paste. What makes it special is that potatoes are served as a side dish instead of rice.
thaiName: ไก่ตุ๋นเต้าเจี้ยวมันฝรั่ง

description: In “Gai Yang” ( ไก่ย่าง ), a whole chicken is marinated in a mixture of fish sauce, garlic, coriander root, pepper and other spices and then grilled until crispy. It is often served with sticky rice and the sweet and spicy dipping sauce “Nam Jim Gai”.
thaiName: ไก่ย่าง

description: “Goong Chae Nam Plaa” ( กุ้งแช่น้ำปลา ) is a Thai dish made from raw prawns marinated in a mixture of fish sauce, lime juice, garlic and chilli. The acidity of the lime causes a so-called “denaturation” of certain proteins in the prawns, which is comparable to a very gentle cooking process. The prawns are then served together with fresh herbs such as mint and coriander.
thaiName: กุ้งแช่น้ำปลา

description: In “Gung Ob Wun Sen” ( กุ้งอบวุ้นเส้น ), glass noodles and prawns are baked together with ginger, garlic and black pepper in a metal or clay pot. The noodles take on the taste of the prawns and spices, giving them a unique aroma.
thaiName: กุ้งอบวุ้นเส้น

description: “Goong Pad Makham” ( กุ้งผัดมะขาม ) are prawns that are fried with a sour and spicy sauce. This sauce consists of tamarind paste, garlic, chilies, fish sauce and sugar. The dish can also be found under the name “Goong Pad Sot Makham” ( กุ้งผัดซอสมะขาม ).
thaiName: กุ้งผัดมะขาม

description: “Goong Pad Nam Prik Pao” ( กุ้งผัดน้ำพริกเผา ) is a stir-fry with prawns in a sweet-salty sauce made from roasted chili paste (Nam Prik Pao), fish sauce, and a little sugar. The dish is seasoned with garlic, shallots, and Thai basil, and served with jasmine rice.
thaiName: กุ้งผัดน้ำพริกเผา

description: “Goong Pad Prik Gratiam” ( กุ้งผัดพริกกระเทียม ) refers to prawns that are stir-fried with chopped garlic and chilli peppers. The dish is then deglazed with a mixture of crushed pepper, soy sauce, fish sauce and oyster sauce.
thaiName: กุ้งผัดพริกกระเทียม

description: "Goong Ping" ( กุ้งปิ้ง ), also called “Goong Yang” ( กุ้งย่าง ) or “Goong Pao” ( กุ้งเผา ), is grilled prawns, a popular Thai street food dish. The prawns are grilled whole over charcoal, giving them a smoky flavor. They are typically served with Nam Jim Talee.
thaiName: กุ้งปิ้ง

transcription: Goong Sap Pad Prik Khi Nu Suan
description: In “Goong Sap Pad Prik Khi Nu Suan” ( กุ้งสับผัดพริกขี้หนูสวน ), prawns are chopped into coarse pieces and then stir-fried together with chopped bird’s eye chilis, pepper, fish sauce and oyster sauce. Since this dish is often served on rice, it can also be found under the longer name “Khao Na Goong Sap Pad Prik Khi Nu Suan” ( ข้าวหน้ากุ้งสับผัดพริกขี้หนูสาน ).
alternativeNames: Gung Sap Pad Prik Kee Nu Suan
Goong Sap Phat Phrik Khee Nu Suan
thaiName: กุ้งสับผัดพริกขี้หนูสวน

summary: Fried Prawns with Garlic and Pepper
description: “Goong Thod Gratiam Prik Thai” ( กุ้งทอดกระเทียมพริกไทย ) are prawns that are stir-fried together with garlic and pepper as well as soy and fish sauce. The dish can also be found under the names “Goong Pad Gratiam Prik Thai” ( กุ้งผัดกระเทียมพริกไทย ) or “Goong Gratiam Prik Thai” ( กุ้งกระเทียมพริกไทย ).
thaiName: กุ้งทอดกระเทียมพริกไทย

description: “Gung Tom Wan” ( กุ้งต้มหวาน ) is a dish from Central Thailand, in which prawns are cooked together with palm sugar and salt, until they have a slightly sweet glaze.
thaiName: กุ้งต้มหวาน

description: "Gratiam Dong" ( กระเทียมดอง ) refers to whole or halved garlic bulbs that are pickled in a sweet-sour solution of rice vinegar, water, sugar, and salt. After a few days to about one week of resting, the garlic develops a mild, aromatic pungency and is served in small amounts as a side or seasoning.
thaiName: กระเทียมดอง

description: “Gunchiang Pad Khai” ( กุนเชียงผัดไข่ ) is a simple Thai wok dish in which Chinese sausage is stir-fried together with beaten eggs and spring onions. The dish is also known as “Pad Gunchiang Sai Khai” ( ผัดกุนเชียงใส่ไข่ ).
thaiName: กุนเชียงผัดไข่

description: Dishes from the book

"Hed Dong" ( เห็ดดอง ) refers to mushrooms that are marinated in a mixture of fish sauce and salt. After the mushrooms have been marinated for at least twelve hours, they are cooked and then mixed with Thai chilis, shallots and lime juice. Several different types of mushrooms are usually used for this. These mushrooms are often served with sticky rice or eaten like a salad.
thaiName: เห็ดดอง

description: “Hed Hom Thod See Ew” ( เห็ดหอมทอดซีอิ๊ว ) are deep-fried shiitake mushrooms that are stir-fried with soy sauce after frying. The dish comes from Chinese-influenced Thai cuisine and is served as a side dish or vegetarian main course.
thaiName: เห็ดหอมทอดซีอิ๊ว

transcription: Hed Hoo Noo Pad Pak Khad Dong
summary: Stir-Fried Wood Ear Mushrooms with Pickled Mustard Greens
description: "Hed Hoo Noo Pad Pak Khad Dong" ( เห็ดหูหนูผัดผักกาดดอง ) is a simple stir-fry dish from northern Thailand, in which chopped wood ear mushrooms are stir-fried together with shredded pickled mustard greens. The dish is seasoned with garlic, pepper, sesame oil, and soy sauce.
alternativeNames: Het Huu Nuu Phat Phak Gaat Daawng
thaiName: เห็ดหูหนูผัดผักกาดดอง

description: “Hed Khem Thong Thod” ( เห็ดเข็มทองทอด ) refers to deep-fried enoki mushrooms. These are dipped in batches into a simple batter batter and then deep-fried in hot oil until crispy. They are a popular street food snack and are often served with a sweet and sour sauce. This snack is also known as “Thod Man Hed Khem Thong” ( ทอดมันเห็ดเข็มทอง ).
thaiName: เห็ดเข็มทองทอด

description: “Hed Nueng Nam Prik Kha” ( เห็ดนึ่งน้ำพริกข่า ) consists of mushrooms that are steamed over hot water vapor. Any type of mushrooms can be used for this. The finished mushrooms are served together with a spicy galangal dip or “Nam Prik Kha”.
thaiName: เห็ดนึ่งน้ำพริกข่า

description: “Hed Pad Galam Pli” ( เห็ดผัดกะหล่ำปลี ) is a simple stir-fry dish with mushrooms and mustard cabbage leaves. For example, oyster mushrooms and Chinese cabbage or bok choy are suitable for this. Both are stir-fried with garlic and chilies before being deglazed with oyster sauce, fish sauce and soy sauce.
thaiName: เห็ดผัดกะหล่ำปลี

description: “Hoi Malaeng Poo Tom Yum” ( หอยแมลงภู่ต้มยำ ) refers to mussels that are cooked in a Tom Yum broth.
thaiName: หอยแมลงภู่ต้มยำ

description: “Hoi Pad Nam Prik Pao” ( หอยผัดน้ำพริกเผา ) consists of shellfish or sea snails that are stir-fried together with the chilli paste “Nam Prik Pao” and other spices. Regardless of which type of shellfish is used in this dish, it is finally mixed with Thai basil leaves.
thaiName: หอยผัดน้ำพริกเผา

description:
In the street food classic “Hoi Thod” ( หอยทอด ), oysters or other mussels are fried in a thin batter and then mixed with egg, creating a kind of omelette. The whole dish is then served with sprouts and a chili sauce.
HistoryYou can learn more about the history of this dish in the video “Hoi Tod: How War, Money, and Chinese Mythology Created a Thai Street Food Classic” by OTR Food & History.
thaiName: หอยทอด

description: "Hom Daeng Jiao" ( หอมแดงเจียว ) are deep-fried shallots used as a garnish and flavor component in Thai cuisine. The shallots are thinly sliced and deep-fried in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. They add a pleasant sweetness, nutty flavor and crispy texture to many dishes.
thaiName: หอมแดงเจียว

description: “Hor Mok Khanom Krok” ( ห่อหมกขนมครก ) is the name of a southern Thai dish in which a curry made from pounded fish, curry paste, coconut milk, egg and various spices is cooked in a khanom krok pan. The small, round indentations in the pan create small morsels, which are usually garnished with finely chopped kaffir lime leaves and pieces of chili.
thaiName: ห่อหมกขนมครก

summary: Steamed fish in a Banana Leaf
description:
"Hor Mok Plaa" ( ห่อหมกปลา ) is a coconut milk curry with pounded fish that is thickened with egg and then steamed in a banana leaf . There is a very similar dish in Cambodia called “Amok Trei”. The extent to which these two dishes have influenced each other has not yet been conclusively clarified.
Hor mok plaa can also be steamed in a fireproof bowl, but then the dish lacks the typical aroma of the banana leaves.
thaiName: ห่อหมกปลา

description:
“Hot pan” ( ฮ็อตแพน ) describes Thai dishes that are served on a very hot cast-iron plate or flat pan. The term is a loan word from English and is derived from “hot pan”. The sauce thickens due to the intense heating of the dishes. The food usually still sizzles when served.
This type of preparation is therefore not a classic or regional dish, but rather an urban food trend that has become particularly popular in Bangkok, Chiang Mai or tourist hotspots. Dishes of this type can also be found as “hot plates” ( ฮ็อตเพลท ).
thaiName: ฮ็อตแพน

description: Dishes from the book

The "Jeaw Goong" ( แจ่วกุ้ง ) is a dip from Isaan that is prepared with crushed Prawns, chilis, galangal, fish sauce, plaa ra, lime juice and all kinds of herbs. The finished dip is served with raw vegetables and sticky rice.
thaiName: แจ่วกุ้ง

description: “Jaew Makuea Thet” ( แจ่วมะเขือเทศ ) is a dip from Isaan. To prepare it, tomatoes, chili peppers, garlic, shallots, and fermented or dried fish are roasted and then ground into a paste. This paste is then diluted with lime juice or tamarind paste to make a dip. The dip is also known as “Jeaw Mak Len” which is also the Lao name ແຈ່ວຫມາກເລັ່ນ.
thaiName: แจ่วมะเขือเทศ

description: “Jim Jum” ( จิ้มจุ่ม ) is a hot pot dish from Isaan. The Thai name means something like “dip, dunk” and describes pictorially how the dish is eaten. Broth is heated in a clay pot, into which various fresh ingredients are then dipped until they are cooked. A spicy dipping sauce is usually served alongside.
thaiName: จิ้มจุ่ม

description: “Jin dup” ( จิ้นตุ๊บ ) is grilled beef or pork that is beaten into fibrous pieces with a hammer. The meat is often marinated before grilling and then left on the grill for a very long time. If it is pork, the hammered meat is also known as “moo dup” ( หมูตุ๊บ ). This preparation method from northern Thailand used to make it possible to eat meat that would otherwise have been too tough.
thaiName: จิ้นตุ๊บ

description: “Jin Thod Song Krueang” ( จิ้นทอดทรงเครื่อง ) is a northern Thai salad with pork belly. The meat is marinated with salt and fish sauce and then fried. The crispy pork belly is then mixed with roasted garlic, shallots, chili peppers and fresh herbs. The whole thing is finally dressed with fish sauce and lime juice as a salad.
thaiName: จิ้นทอดทรงเครื่อง

description: “Jok Goong” ( โจ๊กกุ้ง ) is a Thai rice porridge that achieves a creamy consistency through long cooking of broken or already cooked rice in broth. The broth is seasoned with garlic, coriander roots, pepper and fish sauce, while prawns are cooked in it. Fresh herbs, roasted garlic or shallots are added when serving.
thaiName: โจ๊กกุ้ง

description: “Jok Man Goong Savoey” ( โจ๊กมันกุ้งเสวย ) is a spicy Thai rice porridge. Through long cooking of broken rice or already cooked rice from the previous day in broth, this achieves a creamy consistency. The broth is seasoned with garlic, coriander roots and pepper as well as Nam Prik Pao and the prawn paste “Man Goong Savoey”. This spicy rice porridge is garnished with fresh herbs, roasted garlic or shallots and possibly dry Nam Prik Na Rok Goong.
thaiName: โจ๊กมันกุ้งเสวย

description: "Jok Moo Sap" ( โจ๊กหมูสับ ) is a Thai rice porridge that achieves a creamy consistency through long cooking of broken rice or already cooked rice from the previous day in broth. The broth is seasoned with garlic, coriander roots and pepper as well as soy sauce and ginger. Coarse meatballs are cooked in this broth. The rice porridge is garnished with fresh herbs, roasted garlic or shallots and possibly a dry Nam Prik.
thaiName: โจ๊กหมูสับ

summary: Soup with Pork Belly and Choy Sum
description: The Northern Thai “Jor Pak Khad” ( จอผักกาด ) is a sour soup with pork belly and choy sum. The dish is also found under the names “Pak Khad Jor” ( ผักกาดจอ ) or “Tom Pak Khad Jor” ( ต้มผักกาดจอ ).
thaiName: ผักกาดจอ

description: In Thailand, "Khaep Moo" ( แคบหมู ) refers to fried or baked pork skin. These are usually only seasoned with salt or soy sauce, but there are also varieties with more spices. Another name for this popular snack is “Nang Moo Grob” ( หนังหมูกรอบ ).
thaiName: แคบหมู

description: “Khai Dao” ( ไข่ดาว ) refers to Thai fried eggs that are deep-fried in plenty of hot oil until the egg whites are crispy and golden brown . The trick is that the yolks should ideally remain runny.
thaiName: ไข่ดาว

description: “Khai Jiew” ( ไข่เจียว ) is an omelette that can be filled or topped with various ingredients such as minced meat, seafood as well as mushrooms and vegetables. The omelette is cooked in a wok with plenty of oil and high heat to make it nice and fluffy. Filled omelettes are sometimes regionally also called “Khai Yad Sai” ( ไข่ยัดไส้ ).
thaiName: ไข่เจียว

description: “Khai Jiew Cha Om” ( ไข่เจียวชะอม ) is an omelet with acacia shoots. This is often used as an ingredient in curries like Gaeng Som.
thaiName: ไข่เจียวชะอม

description: “Khai Jiew Dok Seno” ( ไข่เจียวดอกโสน ) is a Thai omelette with yellow sesbania flowers. The flowers are mixed with garlic and soy sauce into the beaten eggs and then fried until golden brown in hot oil. Depending on the recipe, the omelette can also contain shallots, spring onions, fresh herbs, or very finely chopped vegetables.
thaiName: ไข่เจียวดอกโสน

description: “Khai Jiew Gunchiang” ( ไข่เจียวกุนเชียง ) is an omelette with Chinese Gunchiang sausage.
thaiName: ไข่เจียวกุนเชียง

description: “Khai Jiew Moo Sap” ( ไข่เจียวหมูสับ ) is an omelette where minced pork is mixed into the beaten eggs. The omelette is cooked in a wok with plenty of oil and high heat to make it particularly fluffy.
thaiName: ไข่เจียวหมูสับ

description: “Khai Jiew Naem” ( ไข่เจียวแหนม ) is a Thai omelette with fermented “Naem” sausage.
thaiName: ไข่เจียวแหนม

description: “Khai Jiew Sai Ua” ( ไข่เจียวไส้อั่ว ) is the name given to an omelette in which slices or pieces of the northern Thai sausage ‘Sai Ua’ ( ไส้อั่ว ) are mixed into the beaten eggs.
thaiName: ไข่เจียวไส้อั่ว

description:
“Khai Jiew Samun Prai” ( ไข่เจียวสมุนไพร ) refers to an omelette made from chicken eggs, mixed with fresh herbs such as coriander or wild betel pepper leaves as well as lemongrass, spring onions, garlic and chilis.
Sometimes minced meat is also added to the omelette. In “Thailand: The Cookbook” there is such a recipe that is called “Khai Jiew Samun Prai Chao Wang” ( ไข่เจียวสมุนไพรชาววัง ), meaning in the style of the royal court.
alternativeNames: Khai Jiew Samun Prai Chao Wang
thaiName: ไข่เจียวสมุนไพร

summary: Fried eggs with sausage and minced meat
description: Khai Kratha" ( ไข่กระทะ ) is the name given to fried eggs in Isaan. These are fried together with minced meat and various types of sausage such as Moo Yor and Gunchiang. The dish is then topped with deep-fried garlic, spring onions, shallots and tomatoes. Typically, this dish is served with baguette or toast and a chili sauce.
thaiName: ไข่กระทะ

description: "Khai Luk Koei" ( ไข่ลูกเขย ) are hard-boiled and then deep-fried eggs served with a thick sauce made from sugar, fish sauce, chilis and tamarind paste. The sauce is poured over the eggs and the dish is garnished with fried shallots, fresh coriander and chili strips.
thaiName: ไข่ลูกเขย

transcription: Khai Pad Thaeng Gwa Sai Moo
summary: Stir-fried Egg with Cucumber and Pork
description: "Khai Pad Thaeng Gwa Sai Moo" ( ไข่ผัดแตงกวาใส่หมู ) is a quick stir-fry dish where pork belly is fried first, followed by cucumbers. Both are then mixed with beaten eggs seasoned with fish sauce, a little palm sugar, and white pepper. Once the eggs are set, the dish is served with jasmine rice. It is also known as “Pad Thaeng Gwa Sai Moo Sam Chan” ( ผัดแตงกวาใส่หมูสามชั้น ).
alternativeNames: Khai Phat Thaeng Gwa Sai Moo
Khai Pad Taeng Kwa Sai Moo
Khai Pat Taeng Kwa Sai Moo
Khai Phat Taeng Kwa Sai Moo
Pad Thaeng Gwa Sai Moo Sam Chan
thaiName: ไข่ผัดแตงกวาใส่หมู

description:
In Northern Thailand, "Khai Pam" ( ไข่ปาม ) refers to eggs that are grilled in banana leaves. The eggs are beaten and mixed with various ingredients such as fish sauce, Plaa Ra, and chilis, as well as fresh herbs, before being poured into folded banana leaves and then grilled over an open flame until fully set.
Depending on the recipe, the eggs can also be mixed with minced meat, mushrooms, or ant eggs before grilling. Unlike other dishes prepared in banana leaves, the top of the banana leaves remains open for Khai Pam. The dish is also known as “Pam Khai” ( ปามไข่ ) or “Ok Khai” ( อกไข่ ).
thaiName: ไข่ปาม

description: “Khai Tom Rad Nam Yum” ( ไข่ต้มราดน้ำยำ ) are hard-boiled eggs that are drizzled with a sauce made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar. The eggs are then garnished with shallots, chilli rings and coriander. This dish is similar in taste to Yum Khai Tom, but the ingredients are mixed more thoroughly in that dish.
thaiName: ไข่ต้มราดน้ำยำ

description: “Khai Toon” ( ไข่ตุ๋น ) refers to beaten eggs that are steamed in hot water vapor until they become firm. Usually the eggs are seasoned with soy sauce and fish sauce before steaming. There are countless variations where the eggs are mixed with or topped with seafood, ground meat, or mushrooms.
thaiName: ไข่ตุ๋น

summary: Steamed Egg with Shrimp and Mushrooms
description: “Khai Toon Goong Hed” ( ไข่ตุ๋นกุ้งเห็ด ) refers to a steamed dish with eggs, mushrooms, spring onions and dried and chopped fresh shrimp. This mixture is seasoned with fish and soy sauce and then steamed in hot water vapor until it sets. In “Thailand: The Cookbook” the dish can simply be found as “Khai Toon” ( ไข่ตุ๋น ).
thaiName: ไข่ตุ๋นกุ้งเห็ด

summary: Steamed Egg with Shrimp and Coconut Milk
description: “Khai Toon Khoey Khem” ( ไข่ตุ๋นเคยเค็ม ) is a steamed dish from Southern Thailand. For this, eggs are mixed with coconut milk, dried or pickled shrimp, shallots and chilis. This mixture is then steamed in hot water vapor until it sets.
thaiName: ไข่ตุ๋นเคยเค็ม

description: “Khai Toon Moo Sap” ( ไข่ตุ๋นหมูสับ ) is steamed eggs with a topping of minced pork. Depending on the recipe, the minced meat is either cooked together in the hot steam or separately stir-fried with spices such as garlic and chilis and finally placed over the steamed eggs.
thaiName: ไข่ตุ๋นหมูสับ

description: “Khai Yad Sai Sapparot” ( ไข่ยัดไส้สับปะรด ) is an omelette filled with a mixture of minced pork, onions and shallots. The filling is stir-fried separately and then deglazed with oyster sauce and soy sauce before being stuffed into the omelette.
thaiName: ไข่ยัดไส้สับปะรด

summary: Deep-Fried Toast with Minced Pork and Prawns
description: “Khanom Bang Na Moo Goong” ( ขนมปังหน้าหมูกุ้ง ) refers to halved or quartered toast slices that are coated with a mixture of minced pork and minced prawns and then deep-fried. Depending on the recipe, the toast slices are also topped with a sesame or coriander-chilli topping before frying. The meat and prawn mixture is seasoned with the three best friends (“Sam Gloe”) garlic, pepper and coriander root as well as a few other ingredients.
thaiName: ขนมปังหน้าหมูกุ้ง

summary: Crispy Mini Crêpes with Foam Filling
description: "Khanom Bueang" ( ขนมเบื้อง ) are small, taco- or shell-shaped crêpes that can be found at almost every market in Thailand. The mini crêpes are topped with a foam made from beaten egg white and sugar. The foam is then garnished with colorful toppings, typically golden Foi Thong threads or red-dyed coconut shavings.
thaiName: ขนมเบื้อง

description:
“Khanom Chan” ( ขนมชั้น ) is a dessert made from tapioca flour, rice flour, mung bean flour, arrowroot starch, sugar and coconut milk. These ingredients are mixed into a dough and then steamed in several layers.
The layers are prepared individually and colored to different intensities with natural colorings such as pandan, kran or anchan. Nowadays, food coloring is also frequently used for this purpose.
In Thailand, Khanom Chan is usually prepared with nine layers, as this number has religious significance. Therefore, this colorful layered cake is also often used for Buddhist ceremonies.
The name of this popular dessert is derived from two Thai words. First “Khanom” (ขนม), which means “dessert”, and then “Chan” (ชั้น), which can be translated as “layer” or “level”.
thaiName: ขนมชั้น

transcription: Khanom Jeen Gaeng Keow Wan Nuea
summary: Rice noodles with green beef curry
description: The “Khanom Jeen Gaeng Keow Wan Nuea” ( ขนมจีนแกงเขียวหวานเนื้อ ) is a green curry with beef and vegetables, which is served with fresh “Khanom Jeen” rice noodles instead of rice. As the broth here is also much thinner than in other green curries, the line between curry and soup is blurred in this dish.
alternativeNames: Kanom Djin Gaeng Khiau Wan Nuea
Kanom Jin Gaeng Khiau Wan Nuea
Khanom Jeen Geang Kiew Wan Nuea
Khanom Jeen Keang Kiew Wan Nuea
thaiName: ขนมจีนแกงเขียวหวานเนื้อ

summary: Rice Vermicelli with Chicken Curry and Chili-Coconut Dip
description:
"Khanom Jeen Gai Khua" ( ขนมจีนไก่คั่ว ) is a dish of rice vermicelli topped with a curry sauce made with chopped chicken. It is typically served with a spicy dip of crushed red and orange chilis and coconut milk.
The dish originates from Bangkok and is said to have Portuguese-Thai roots. It is also known as “Khanom Jeen Gaeng Khua Gai” ( ขนมจีนแกงคั่วไก่ ).
thaiName: ขนมจีนไก่คั่ว

transcription: Khanom Jeen Hai Lam Haeng Nuea
summary: Hainan Rice Noodles with Braised Beef
description:
“Khanom Dschin Hai Lam Haeng Nuea” ( ขนมจีนไหหลำแห้งเนื้อ ) is a noodle dish, that came to Bangkok with Chinese immigrants and was adapted to Thai flavours over time. It consists of thick, round rice noodles that are served with a thickened beef stew. This stew is similar to “Nuea Dtun” and is flavoured with dark soy sauce, Chinese cooking wine, cinnamon, star anise and cloves .
This dish is typically served with a sour and spicy dip made from shrimp paste, chilis, garlic and vinegar, which balances out the slightly sweet flavour of the stew. The rice noodles and stew are usually garnished with sesame seeds, crushed peanuts, pickled vegetables, coriander and spring onions.
alternativeNames: Khanom Dschin Hai Lam Haeng Nuea
thaiName: ขนมจีนไหหลำแห้งเนื้อ

description:
“Khanom Jeen Nam Ya” ( ขนมจีนน้ำยา ) originates from Southern Thailand and is a dish with rice noodles and a special curry sauce without coconut milk. The Nam Ya curry paste is characterized by the use of a large amount of fingerroot, and some fish meat is pounded together with the curry paste and essentially incorporated into it. These were often leftovers from the previous day.
The name “Nam Ya” can be translated as “liquid medicine,” possibly because fingerroot is also used in traditional medicine. Classic additions to the curry include fish, seafood, or fish balls.
thaiName: ขนมจีนน้ำยา

summary: Rice Noodles and Nam Ya With Coconut Milk
description: “Khanom Jeen Nam Ya Kati” ( ขนมจีนน้ำยากะทิ ) is a variation of Khanom Jeen Nam Ya where coconut milk is used in the curry sauce.
thaiName: ขนมจีนน้ำยากะทิ

transcription: Khanom Jeen Nam Ya Look Chin Plaa
summary: Rice Noodles with Nam Ya Curry and Fish Balls
description: “Khanom Jeen Nam Ya Look Chin Plaa” ( ขนมจีนน้ำยาลูกชิ้นปลา ) is a curry with fish balls based on Nam Ya curry paste. The curry is served together with “Khanom Jeen” rice noodles. This dish is usually accompanied by fresh vegetables such as yard long beans, pickled cabbage and fresh herbs.
alternativeNames: Khanom Jeen Nam Ya Look Chin Plaa
Khanom Jeen Nam Ya Luk Chin Plaa
Khanom Dschin Nam Ya Luk Shin Plaa
Kanom Djin Nam Ya Luk Chin Plaa
Kanom Jin Nam Ya Luk Chin Plaa
Kanom Jeen Nam Ya Luk Chin Plaa
thaiName: ขนมจีนน้ำยาลูกชิ้นปลา

summary: Rice Noodles with Pineapple, Spices and Coconut Milk
description: "Khanom Jeen Sao Nam" ( ขนมจีนซาวน้ำ ) consists of soft rice noodles served with chopped pineapple, crushed peanuts or cashews, young ginger, dried shrimp, fish balls or seafood and a sauce made from coconut milk, tamarind paste, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ขนมจีนซาวน้ำ

description: “Khanom Jeep” ( ขนมจีบ ) are steamed dumplings that are primarily filled with pork, prawns or a mixture of both. They have their origins in Chinese cuisine, where they are called “Siu Mai” (燒賣), and are a popular street food snack. Khanom Jeep are usually steamed in a traditional bamboo steamer and normally served with a savoury dip.
thaiName: ขนมจีบ

summary: Small coconut pancakes as a snack
description:
Khanom krok ( ขนมครก ) are small pancakes made from rice flour and coconut milk, which are baked in large iron pans with small, round indentations . This is usually done in two steps. First, the batter is baked to create a crispy base, and then the creamy, slightly sweetened coconut milk filling is added on top.
The pudding-like filling is often garnished with spring onions, dried prawns, corn kernels and pieces of pumpkin or taro. The real art in preparing khanom krok lies in harmoniously combining the sweet and savory flavours. Sometimes two khanom krok are combined and served as a small ball.
thaiName: ขนมครก

description: "Khanom Mo Kaeng" ( ขนมหม้อแกง ) is a dessert made from coconut milk, eggs, palm sugar, white sugar, salt, fried shallots and oil. It originated during the Ayutthaya period at the court of the king and is influenced by Portuguese cuisine, which was very popular there at the time.
thaiName: ขนมหม้อแกง

description: “Khanom Pia” ( ขนมเปี๊ยะ ) is a Thai pastry with a soft, thin dough shell, usually made from wheat flour and lard. The filling varies and ranges from sweet versions like sweetened mung bean paste or salted egg yolk to savory fillings. The pastry likely came to Thailand with Chinese immigrants.
thaiName: ขนมเปี๊ยะ

summary: Dessert with rice pudding and coconut cream
description: “Khanom Tako” ( ขนมตะโก้ ) is a two-layered dessert. The top layer consists of coconut cream, while the bottom layer is formed by a pudding made from rice flour. The pudding is usually mixed with corn kernels, taro pieces, water chestnuts, lotus seeds, pieces of yam or a mixture of these ingredients. Khanom tako is served in baskets made from pandan leaves or banana leaves.
thaiName: ขนมตะโก้

description: “Khao Kha Moo” ( ข้าวขาหมู ) is a Thai dish made from slowly braised pork shank, which is cooked in a dark broth with soy sauce, garlic and various spices. The meat is served on rice, usually with pickled mustard cabbage and a hard-boiled egg. The dish originates from Chinese-Thai cuisine and is served in many Thai cookshops.
thaiName: ข้าวขาหมู
