The “Tam Strobori” owes its strange name to the loanword for “strawberry”, the English translation of strawberry. This is called “Sa Tro Bo Ri” (สตรอเบอร์รี่) or “Sa To Bo Ri” (สตอเบอรี่) in Thai. Therefore, there are also two different spellings ( ตำสตอเบอรี่ ) and ( ตำสตรอเบอร์รี่ ) for this salad.
thaiName: ตำสตรอเบอร์รี่

description: “Tam Thaeng Gwa” ( ตำแตงกวา ) from Isaan consists of cucumber, snake beans and tomatoes that are pounded in a mortar and mixed with a sauce made from fermented fish sauce, lime juice and sugar. Optionally, the salad can also contain crushed peanuts. According to the book “Thailand: The Cookbook,” this salad is also called “Som Tam Thaeng Plaa Ra” ( ส้มตำแตงปลาร้า ).
thaiName: ตำแตงกวา

description: “Tam Thua Fak Yao” ( ตำถั่วฝักยาว ) is a salad made from raw yard long beans that originates from Isaan. The yard long beans are pounded and mixed in a mortar together with garlic, chilis, palm sugar, lime and fish sauce. Depending on the recipe, other vegetables such as raw Thai eggplants are mixed with the yard long beans. This salad can also be found under the names “Tam Thua” ( ตำถั่ว ) or “Yam Thua Fak Yao” ( ยำถั่วฝักยาว ).
thaiName: ตำถั่วฝักยาว

description:
"Tao Hu Pad Pak Choi" ( เต้าหู้ผัดผักฉ่อย ) is a simple stir-fry dish in which firm tofu is fried together with bok choy. The tofu is first fried with garlic and yellow bean paste before the bok choy is added.
All ingredients are then deglazed with a mixture of soya sauce, fish sauce and oyster sauce. The dish can be made vegetarian by omitting the oyster sauce and fish sauce or by finding suitable vegetarian substitutes for these sauces.
thaiName: เต้าหู้ผัดผักฉ่อย

description: “Tao Hu Pad Thua Nog” ( เต้าหู้ผัดถั่วงอก ) is a very simple wok dish with crispy fried tofu and mung bean sprouts. You can also prepare this completely vegetarian by replacing the oyster sauce with vegetarian mushroom sauce.
thaiName: เต้าหู้ผัดถั่วงอก

description: “Tao Hu Thod Nam Jim” ( เต้าหู้ทอดน้ำจิ้ม ) is a Thai snack made of crispy deep-fried tofu served with a dip. The dip usually consists of garlic, chilis, and peanuts, and is seasoned with salt, palm sugar, tamarind paste, or vinegar, combining spicy with sweet flavors.
thaiName: เต้าหู้ทอดน้ำจิ้ม

description: “Tap Wan” ( ตับหวาน ) is a salad with cooked or fried pork liver. The liver is mixed with shallots, spring onions and fresh herbs such as coriander or mint. The salad is then dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice, sugar and chili flakes.
thaiName: ตับหวาน

description: In Thailand, “Thaeng Mo Plaa Haeng” ( แตงโมปลาแห้ง ) is watermelon cut into pieces and served with dried fish. The fish is grilled or baked, then pounded in a mortar and finally fried together with shallots, garlic, sugar and other spices. This refreshing snack has been part of royal cuisine since the reign of King Rama IV. The dish can also be found at under the reverse name “Plaa Haeng Thaeng Mo” ( ปลาแห้งแตงโม ).
thaiName: แตงโมปลาแห้ง

description: Dishes from the book
Dishes from the book

transcription: The Best of Regional Thai Cuisine
description: Dishes from the book
Dishes from the book
Dishes from the book
Dishes from the book

transcription: The Most Popular Thai Dipping Sauces
description: Dishes from the book
Dishes from the book

"Thod Man Goong" ( ทอดมันกุ้ง ) are Thai prawn cakes made from minced prawn meat, curry paste, and various spices. Chopped yard long beans and kaffir lime leaves are often mixed into this mixture. The whole mixture is then formed into small patties and deep-fried. “Ajaad Thaeng Gwa” goes well with it as a dip.
thaiName: ทอดมันกุ้ง

description: “Thod Man Plaa” ( ทอดมันปลา ) are Thai fish cakes made from minced fish, curry paste, and various spices. This mixture is often mixed with chopped yard long beans and kaffir lime leaves, then formed into small patties and deep-fried. They are often served with “Ajaad Thaeng Gwa” as a dip.
thaiName: ทอดมันปลา

summary: Stir-Fried Yard Long Beans Sichuan Style
description: "Thua Fak Yao Pad Sechuan" ( ถั่วฝักยาวผัดเสฉวน ) is a simple stir-fry dish where yard long beans are stir-fried together with garlic, dried chilis, Sichuan pepper, and yellow bean paste. The dish resembles the Sichuan dish “Gān Biān Sì Jì Dòu” (干煸四季豆) with a modified recipe. As with the original, the beans can also be mixed with minced meat. It can also be found under the spelling “Thua Fak Yao Pad Sawen” ( ถั่วฝักยาวผัดเสวน ).
thaiName: ถั่วฝักยาวผัดเสฉวน

description: To make them last longer, fermented soy beans or Aep Thua Nao are steamed, formed into flat sheets and dried in the sun. These are known as “Thua Nao Khaep” ( ถั่วเน่าแคบ ). chilis or other spices may be added to the mixture before steaming.
thaiName: ถั่วเน่าแคบ

description: “Thua Phu Pad Kapi Moo” ( ถั่วพูผัดกะปิหมู ) is a wok dish where winged beans and pork are stir-fried in a mixture of garlic, chilis, shrimp paste, oyster sauce and a pinch of sugar.
thaiName: ถั่วพูผัดกะปิหมู

summary: Snack made from peanuts and herbs
description: “Thua Thod Samun Prai” ( ถั่วทอดสมุนไพร ) is a snack made from peanuts that are stir-fried or deep-fried with spices such as chili peppers, kaffir lime leaves, and garlic. This snack is also known by the longer name “Thua Li Song Thod Samun Prai” ( ถั่วลิสงทอดสมุนไพร ) and goes perfectly with alcoholic beverages.
thaiName: ถั่วทอดสมุนไพร

transcription: Tom Dok Mai Jin Hed Hom
description: “Tom Dok Mai Jin Hed Hom” ( ต้มดอกไม้จีนเห็ดหอม ) is a soup with spare ribs, day lily buds, and shiitake mushrooms. The broth is seasoned with the “three friends,” meaning white pepper, garlic, and cilantro roots, as well as some fish sauce.
alternativeNames: Dtom Dok Mai Jin Hed Hom
Tom Dok Mai Chin Hed Hom
thaiName: ต้มดอกไม้จีนเห็ดหอม

transcription: Tom Kati Fak Keaw Woon Sen
summary: Soup with Winter Melon and Glass Noodles
description: “Tom Kati Fak Keaw Woon Sen” ( ต้มกะทิฟักเขียววุ้นเส้น ) is a simple coconut soup prepared with a simple paste made from shallots, white pepper, salt and shrimp paste. Diced winter melon and glass noodles serve as ingredients. The soup is also known as “Tom Kati Fak Sai Woon Sen” ( ต้มกะทิฟักใส่วุ้นเส้น ). Depending on the recipe, the soup may also contain ground meat or seafood.
alternativeNames: Tom Gati Fak Keaw Woon Sen
Tom Gati Fak Keaw Woon Sen
Tom Kati Fak Sai Woon Sen
thaiName: ต้มกะทิฟักเขียววุ้นเส้น

summary: Soup with Lotus Stems and Fish
description: “Tom Kati Sai Bua Plaa” ( ต้มกะทิสายบัวปลา ) is a southern Thai soup with coconut milk, fish, and lotus stems. The soup is based on a paste made from pepper, lemongrass, coriander roots, shallots, and shrimp paste, and is seasoned with tamarind paste and palm sugar. Typically prepared with mackerel, it is then called “Tom Kati Sai Bua Plaa Tu” ( ต้มกะทิสายบัวปลาทู ).
alternativeNames: Tom Sai Bua Plaa Tu Thod
thaiName: ต้มกะทิสายบัวปลา

summary: Coconut and galangal soup with chicken
description: "Tom Kha Gai" ( ต้มข่าไก่ ) is a Thai soup with coconut milk and chicken. It is based on a broth that is flavoured with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chilis and the eponymous galangal (“kha” ข่า). Mushrooms are usually added to the soup alongside the meat.
thaiName: ต้มข่าไก่

transcription: Tom Kha Gai Sai Ma Prau On
description: The “Tom Kha Gai Sai Ma Prau On” ( ต้มข่าไก่ใส่มะพร้าวอ่อน ) is a Thai soup with chicken and young coconut. It is based on a broth with coconut milk, which is seasoned with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chilies, galangal and Nam Prik Pao.
alternativeNames: Tom Kha Gai Sai Maprao On
thaiName: ต้มข่าไก่ใส่มะพร้าวอ่อน

description: “Tom Kha Goong” ( ต้มข่ากุ้ง ) is a Thai soup with coconut milk and shrimp. The coconut broth is seasoned with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chilis and galangal (“Kha” ข่า). Usually straw mushrooms are also found in the soup alongside the shrimp.
thaiName: ต้มข่ากุ้ง

summary: Soup with Bitter Melon and Pork Ribs
description: The “Tom Mara Kra Dhuk Moo” ( ต้มมะระกระดูกหมู ) is a soup with bitter melon and pork spare ribs. The broth is based on a paste made from garlic, coriander roots and white pepper. Dried shiitake mushrooms are also often added to the broth. This soup is also known under the name “Tom Mara Si Khrong Moo” ( ต้มมะระซี่โครงหมู ).
thaiName: ต้มมะระกระดูกหมู

summary: Sour and spicy soup with pork ribs
description:
“Tom Saep Kra Dhuk Moo” ( ต้มแซ่บกระดูกหมู ) or “Tom Saep Moo” for short ( ต้มแซ่บหมู ) is a sour and spicy soup with pork ribs that originates from Isaan. The broth is flavoured with ingredients such as lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, tamarind and usually many Thai chilis, which give it a strong and spicy note.
Mushrooms are often added to the soup as a further garnish. The finished Tom Saep Kra Dhuk Moo is usually garnished with fresh herbs. The dish is also known under the name “Tom Saep Kra Dhuk Gaeu” ( ต้มแซ่บกระดูกแก้ว ).
thaiName: ต้มแซ่บกระดูกหมู

description:
“Tom Saep Kra Dhuk On (ต้มแซ่บกระดูกอ่อน) is a spicy soup with cartilage from Isaan. Its broth is flavoured with various ingredients such as lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, tamarind and usually lots of Thai chilis or chilli powder.
This soup is sometimes also called “Tom Yam Kra Dhuk On” ( ต้มยำกระดูกอ่อน ) or “Tom Saep Kra Dhuk Mhu” ( ต้มแซ่บกระดูกหมู ). The latter name can however also refer to a spicy soup with pork ribs.
thaiName: ต้มแซ่บกระดูกอ่อน

description: “Tom Saep Nuea” ( ต้มแซ่บเนื้อ ) is a clear soup with beef from Isaan. The broth is seasoned with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, lime, fish sauce, fresh Thai chilies, chili powder and roasted rice powder. In addition to the meat, it can also contain vegetables such as tomatoes, Thai eggplants and various mushrooms.
thaiName: ต้มแซ่บเนื้อ

summary: Sour Soup with Fish and Rice Paddy Herb
description: “Tom Som Plaa Pak Kayaeng” ( ต้มส้มปลาผักแขยง ) is a sour soup seasoned with galangal, lemongrass, cilantro roots, tamarind paste, lime, palm sugar and fish sauce. Fish and some stems of the rice paddy herb, called “Pak Kayaeng” in Thai, serve as ingredients.
thaiName: ต้มส้มปลาผักแขยง

description: “Tom Yum Gai” ( ต้มยำไก่ ) is a sour and spicy soup with chicken. The clear broth is seasoned with lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves and Nam Prik Pao.
thaiName: ต้มยำไก่

description: “Tom Yum Goong” ( ต้มยำกุ้ง ) is a sour and spicy clear soup with prawns that is seasoned with galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves and Nam Prik Pao.
thaiName: ต้มยำกุ้ง

description: “Tom Yum Goong Haeng” ( ต้มยำกุ้งแห้ง ) is a Thai wok dish with prawns. The prawns are dry stir-fried together with galangal, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves as well as Nam Prik Pao, instead of being cooked in a soup.
thaiName: ต้มยำกุ้งแห้ง

summary: Sour and spicy prawn soup with coconut milk
description:
“Tom Yum Goong Nam Kon” ( ต้มยำกุ้งน้ำข้น ), which is sometimes also called “Tom Yum Goong Kati” ( ต้มยำกุ้งกะทิ ), is a sour and spicy soup with prawns and coconut milk, seasoned with galangal, lemongrass, chilies, kaffir lime leaves, tamarind paste and Nam Prik Pao.
The name suffix “Nam Kon” ( น้ำข้น ) means “with thickened broth” and refers to the use of coconut milk.
thaiName: ต้มยำกุ้งน้ำข้น

description: In “Tom Yum Talee Haeng” ( ต้มยำทะเลแห้ง ), seafood and straw mushrooms are dry stir-fried together with “the trinity of Tom Yum” - galangal, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves as well as Nam Prik Pao in a wok, instead of being made into a soup.
thaiName: ต้มยำทะเลแห้ง

description: “Tung Thong” ( ถุงทอง ) are small dumplings filled with a mixture of minced meat and shrimp. The dumplings are shaped into small pouches and then deep-fried until golden brown and crispy. They are usually served with Nam Jim Gai or a plum sauce.
thaiName: ถุงทอง

description: The southern Thai dish “Yao Ye” ( ยาวเย ) is a type of salad in which deep-fried tofu and prawns are served together with blanched or raw water spinach. The whole thing is then mixed with a sauce made from chilis, garlic, vinegar, fish sauce and palm sugar and sprinkled with crushed cashews, peanuts, fried garlic and sometimes sesame seeds. Another speciality is that the individual ingredients are served separately and you mix the salad yourself.
thaiName: ยาวเย

summary: Snake Bean Salad with Minced Pork
description:
“Yum Ba Thua Ba Khueo” ( ยำบ่าถั่วบ่าเขือ ) from Northern Thailand uses various green vegetables such as snake beans, Thai eggplants and water spinach that are finely chopped and then served together with minced meat in a spicy paste made from chilis, garlic, shallots and shrimp paste.
On the internet you can also find other recipes where all ingredients are crushed and mixed in a mortar. The dish can also be found under the shortened name “Yum Ba Thua Ba” ( ยำบ่าถั่วบ่า ).
thaiName: ยำบ่าถั่วบ่าเขือ

description: “Yum Bai Bua Bok” ( ยำใบบัวบก ) is a salad with Indian pennywort. This herb is then often mixed with meat, seafood or a combination of both. The salad is dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and fresh chilis or dried chili powder.
thaiName: ยำใบบัวบก

summary: Salad with wild betel pepper leaves
description: “Yum Bai Cha Plu” ( ยำใบชะพลู ) is a southern Thai salad made with wild betel pepper leaves and chicken or shrimp. It’s prepared with roasted coconut flakes and peanuts, as well as shallots, fresh chilies, and cilantro leaves. The salad is dressed with a mixture of fish sauce, vinegar, palm sugar, and optionally some fermented rose tofu.
thaiName: ยำใบชะพลู

description: “Yum Dok Kachorn” ( ยำดอกขจร ) is a Thai salad prepared with tender Tonkin flower buds (Dok Kachorn), minced pork and prawns. The salad is dressed with a sour-spicy dressing made from lime, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำดอกขจร

description: “Yum Dok Khae” ( ยำดอกแค ) is a Thai salad made from sesbania grandiflora flowers (Dok Khae). The flowers are blanched in hot water and then mixed with fried meat and prawns, dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำดอกแค

description: “Yum Dok Seno” ( ยำดอกโสน ) is a Thai salad that uses yellow Sesbania flowers as its main ingredient. Usually these are mixed with meat, seafood or a combination of both. The salad is dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar and Thai chilis. Fresh herbs like cilantro, spring onion or mint often serve as garnish.
thaiName: ยำดอกโสน

summary: Minced Pork Salad With Yellow Sesbania Flowers
description: “Yum Dok Seno Moo Sap” ( ยำดอกโสนหมูสับ ) is a Thai salad where yellow Sesbania flowers are mixed with minced pork. Both ingredients are then dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำดอกโสนหมูสับ

description: “Yum Fak Thong Thod” ( ยำฟักทองทอด ) is a Thai salad in which fried pumpkin is mixed with fresh herbs, ground meat and peanuts. This salad is dressed with a mixture of fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and fresh Thai chilis.
thaiName: ยำฟักทองทอด

description: The "Yum Gai" ( ยำไก่ ) is a simple salad where fried chicken is mixed with shallots and fresh herbs with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar. This salad is often also prepared with grilled chicken and then called “Yum Gai Yang” ( ยำไก่ย่าง ).
thaiName: ยำไก่ (ย่าง)

summary: Salad with Chinese Cabbage and Carrots
description: “Yum Galam Plee” ( ยำกะหล่ำปลี ) is a simple salad made from Chinese cabbage mixed with carrots, peanuts and coconut strips. The whole dish is dressed with a dressing made from coarse chili powder, fried garlic, fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำกะหล่ำปลี

description: “Yum Goong Siap” ( ยำกุ้งเสียบ ) is a southern Thai salad with large dried shrimp, unripe green mango, carrots, peanuts or cashews and some herbs. The whole dish is dressed with a sauce made from fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำกุ้งเสียบ

description: The “Yum Goong Sod” ( ยำกุ้งสด ) is a Thai salad in which fried or grilled prawns are mixed with shallots and fresh herbs. The salad is dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar and chilis. Sometimes the salad can also be found at under the shorter name “yam gung” ( ยำกุ้ง ).
thaiName: ยำกุ้งสด

description: “Yum Gunchiang” ( ยำกุนเชียง ) is a salad that uses Chinese sausage as the main ingredient. The sausage is sliced thinly and mixed with fresh herbs, shallots, cucumber slices, and chilis. The salad is dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำกุนเชียง

description: The “Yum Ham” ( ยำแฮม ) is a Thai salad with ham as the main ingredient. The ham, cut into strips, is mixed with herbs, shallots, and sometimes tomatoes or cucumbers, and dressed with a typical yam dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce, chilis, and palm sugar. This salad is an example of adapting Thai preparation methods to Western ingredients, but may also have been prepared earlier with Yunnan ham.
thaiName: ยำแฮม

description: “Yum Hed” ( ยำเห็ด ) refers to a Thai salad made from fried or grilled mushrooms. This is dressed with a mixture made of fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and chilis and served lukewarm. When specific mushrooms are used for the salad, their name is often appended to the name of this salad.
thaiName: ยำเห็ด

description: “Yam Hed Dong” ( ยำเห็ดดอง ) is a Thai salad in which fermented mushrooms are mixed with fresh herbs. Everything together is then dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, sugar and lime juice.
thaiName: ยำเห็ดดอง

description: The northern Thai “Yum Hed Fang” ( ยำเห็ดฟาง ) with straw mushrooms sits somewhere between a salad and a dip and perhaps partly for this reason sometimes bears the name “Tom Yum Hed Fang” ( ส้มตำแตงปลาร้า ).
thaiName: ยำเห็ดฟาง

description: “Yum Hed Hom” ( ยำเห็ดหอม ) is a salad from Isaan. Shiitake mushrooms are briefly blanched and then mixed with various herbs. The salad is then dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime and bouillon cubes and finally garnished with toasted rice flour and chili flakes.
thaiName: ยำเห็ดหอม

summary: Salad With Mushrooms, Minced Pork and Prawns
description: The “Yum Hed Moo Sap Goong” ( ยำเห็ดหมูสับกุ้ง ) is a yum salad with mushrooms, minced pork and prawns. The three ingredients are dressed, as is common with such salads, with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำเห็ดหมูสับกุ้ง

description: In “Yum Hua Plee” ( ยำหัวปลี ) from southern Thailand, a banana blossom is mixed with roasted coconut, chilis and peanuts or cashews. Often fresh or dried shrimp or chicken or pork are added. This salad is then dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice, Nam Prik Pao and palm sugar. There are also regional variants where coconut milk is stirred into the dressing or where the banana blossom is roasted before use.
thaiName: ยำหัวปลี

transcription: Yum Jin Gai Sai Hua Plee
description: “Yum Jin Gai Sai Hua Plee” ( ยำจิ้นไก่ใส่หัวปลี ) is a salad from Northern Thailand where chicken is stir-fried in a chili paste and then mixed with banana blossom, shallots, various herbs, and galangal.
alternativeNames: Yum Jin Kai Sai Hua Plee
thaiName: ยำจิ้นไก่ใส่หัวปลี

description: The “Yum Khaep Moo” ( ยำแคบหมู ) is a salad made from crispy pork rinds, chilis and fresh herbs, dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำแคบหมู

description: The “Yum Khai Dao” ( ยำ ) is a salad with crispy fried eggs and fresh herbs, which is dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar. Depending on the recipe, the dressing can also contain chilis or garlic or both.
thaiName: ยำไข่ดาว

description: The Thai salad “Yum Khai Khon” ( ยำไข่คน ) consists of scrambled eggs that are seasoned with oyster and soy sauce and then fried. After cooling, they are cut into strips and mixed with shallots and coarsely chopped coriander greens. The salad is dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar and Thai chilies.
thaiName: ยำไข่คน

description: “Yum Khai Maeng Daa” ( ยำไข่แมงดา ) is a salad where horseshoe crab eggs are mixed with shallots and fresh herbs, then dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar. Typically, the salad is served in the shell of a horseshoe crab. Sometimes this salad is also found as “Yum Khai Maeng Daa Talee” ( ยำไข่แมงดาทะเล ).
thaiName: ยำไข่แมงดา

description: The "Yum Khai Tom" ( ยำไข่ต้ม ) is a salad with hard-boiled eggs, shallots and fresh herbs. It is dressed with fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and Thai chilies.
thaiName: ยำไข่ต้ม

summary: Salad with Eggs and Minced Meat
description: “Yam Khai Tom Moo Sap” ( ยำไข่ต้มหมูสับ ) is a Thai salad with hard-boiled eggs, minced meat and fresh herbs. The salad is dressed with lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar. Depending on the recipe, Nam Prik Pao can also be added to the dressing.
thaiName: ยำไข่ต้มหมูสับ

summary: Thief Salad with Pork, Prawns and Cucumbers
description:
“Yum Khamoi” ( ยำขโมย ) is a Thai salad that is usually prepared with pork, prawns, cucumbers, hard-boiled eggs and shallots. Unlike most other Yum salads, the dressing for Yum Khamoi uses not only the typical mixture of fish sauce, lime juice, sugar and chilis, but also the “Three Friends” - coriander root, white pepper and garlic.
The name component “Khamoi” ( ขโมย ) can be translated as “steal”, “theft”, “thief” or “robber”. So the salad could be called “Thief Salad” in English. Where this name comes from and who stole what from whom, I have not yet been able to find out.
thaiName: ยำขโมย

description: "Yum Khanom Jeen" ( ยำขนมจีน ) is a Thai salad in which fermented rice noodles or “Khanom Jeen” are mixed with various ingredients such as seafood, meat or vegetables as well as fresh herbs. The salad is dressed with a mixture of fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and fresh chilis or chili powder.
thaiName: ยำขนมจีน

description: “Yum Kra Jiab” ( ยำกระเจี๊ยบ ) is a salad with okra. The okra is used raw and sliced, then mixed with other vegetables such as tomatoes, as well as meat or seafood. The salad is dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar and chilis.
thaiName: ยำกระเจี๊ยบ

description: "Yum Kuai Tiao" ( ยำก๋วยเตี๋ยว ) is a simple Thai dish in which rice noodles are prepared as a salad. The rice noodles are mixed with seafood, meat, Thai sausage, minced meat or a combination of these ingredients. The salad is dressed with a mixture of fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and nam prik pao and garnished with fresh herbs.
thaiName: ยำก๋วยเตี๋ยว

description: “Yum Ma Muang” ( ยำมะม่วง ) is a salad made from unripe mango, cherry tomatoes, peanuts, and dried shrimp. It is dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, chili powder, and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำมะม่วง

description: The “Yum Ma Muang Goong” ( ยำมะม่วงกุ้ง ) is a variation of green mango salad, where fresh shrimps are added to the mango and tomatoes. It is also dressed with a mix of lemon juice, fish sauce, chili powder and sugar.
thaiName: ยำมะม่วงกุ้ง

description: “Yum Ma Muang Ma Prau” ( ยำมะม่วงมะพร้าว ) is a salad from Southern Thailand that is prepared from green, unripe mango and roasted coconut. These two ingredients are dressed with a dressing made from coconut milk, shrimp paste, palm sugar and salt.
thaiName: ยำมะม่วงมะพร้าว

description: “Yum Makhuea Matua” ( ยำมะเขือมะตัว ) is a Northern Thai salad from Chiang Rai Province. Steamed eggplants and other vegetables such as long beans or bitter melon are pounded in a mortar and dressed with a paste made from dried chilis, garlic, shallots, coriander roots and shrimp paste. Depending on the recipe, minced meat may also be mixed into the salad.
thaiName: ยำมะเขือมะตัว

description: The "Yum Makuea Yao" ( ยำมะเขือยาว ) or sometimes just “Yum Makuea” ( ยำมะเขือ ) is a salad with grilled or fried eggplants. These are mixed with Thai chilies, shallots, spring onions and chopped herbs before being dressed with lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar. Long Asian or smaller European eggplants are used for the salad, but not Thai eggplants.
thaiName: ยำมะเขือยาว

summary: Salad with Eggplant and Minced Meat
description: The “Yum Makuea Yao Moo Sap” ( ยำมะเขือยาวหมูสับ ) is a variation of the Yum Makuea Yao in which the grilled or fried eggplant is mixed with minced meat. I recommend using long Japanese eggplants for this because they look very good.
thaiName: ยำมะเขือยาวหมูสับ

description:
The “Yum Mama” ( ยำมาม่า ) is a fairly modern Thai version of a yam salad. For this, cooked instant noodles are mixed with ingredients such as minced meat, mhu yor or sausages, tomatoes and fresh herbs. The salad is then dressed with the typical “Nam Yam” dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar. The salad takes its name from the most popular brand of instant noodles in Thailand, “Mama Noodles”.
Rezepte
thaiName: ยำมาม่า

summary: Salad with Bitter Gourd and Prawns
description: “Yum Mara Goong” ( ยำมะระกุ้ง ) is a salad with sliced bitter gourd and prawns. It is dressed with the usual mixture of lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar typical for yum salads. Sometimes you can find the salad under the name “Yum Mara Goong Sot” ( ยำมะระกุ้งสด ), which emphasizes that it uses fresh prawns. Often chicken or minced meat is also added to the salad.
thaiName: ยำมะระกุ้ง

description: “Yum Moo Daeng” ( ยำหมูแดง ) is a simple Thai salad. In this dish, red-marinated pork is sliced and mixed with fresh herbs and shallots. The salad is then dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำหมูแดง

description: The “Yum Moo Grob” ( ยำหมูกรอบ ) is a Thai salad where crispy pork belly is mixed with shallots and fresh herbs with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and coarse chili powder or fresh chilis.
thaiName: ยำหมูกรอบ

description: “Yum Moo Ob” ( ยำหมูอบ ) is a Thai salad with marinated pork loin that is roasted until golden brown. The meat is mixed with fresh herbs, shallots, and tomatoes, then dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำหมูอบ

description: The “Yum Moo Sam Chan” ( ยำหมูสามชั้น ) is a Thai salad where thin slices of boiled or fried pork belly are mixed with shallots and fresh herbs with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce, and coarse chili powder or fresh chilis. The dressing can also include crushed white peppercorns and coriander roots.
thaiName: ยำหมูสามชั้น

description: “Yum Moo Sap” ( ยำหมูสับ ) is a yum salad with minced pork. The minced pork is mixed together with fresh herbs and raw vegetables such as tomatoes or carrots, with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำหมูสับ

description: “Yum Moo Thakrai” ( ยำหมูตะไคร้ ) or simply “Yum Thakrai” ( ยำตะไคร้ ) is a salad where thin slices of pork are cooked in lime juice and then mixed with lemongrass, Thai chilis, and fresh herbs as a salad. The dressing is a mixture of fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar. This salad is very similar to Moo Manao.
thaiName: ยำหมูตะไคร้

description: “Yum Moo Yang” ( ยำหมูย่าง ) is a salad with grilled pork dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar. The whole dish is then mixed with shallots and fresh herbs and served lukewarm or cold.
thaiName: ยำหมูย่าง

description:
The “Yum Moo Yor” ( ยำหมูยอ ) is a salad with Vietnamese sausage. The sausage is cut into pieces and mixed together with other fresh ingredients such as shallots, spring onions and Thai celery. The salad is dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime and palm sugar.
Alternatively, Yum Moo Yor can also be prepared with german “Fleischwurst” (Meat Sausage), as this is very similar to Vietnamese sausage.
thaiName: ยำหมูยอ

summary: Crunchy rice salad with fermented sausage
description:
“Yum Naem Khao Thod” ( ยำแหนมข้าวทอด ) is a salad from the Isaan region where the rice is marinated with curry paste and other seasonings and then fried crispy. The rice is often shaped into small balls before frying, which are then broken up before serving. The rice is then mixed with fresh herbs, chilies, peanuts and “Naem”, a fermented sausage. The whole thing is then seasoned with chili flakes, lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar.
This salad is also known as “Naem Khao Thod” ( แหนมข้าวทอด ), “Khao Thod Naem” ( ข้าวทอดแหนม ) ,“Khao Thod Naem Khluk” ( ข้าวทอดแหนมคลุก ) or “Naem Khluk” ( แหนมคลุก ). In English it is also known as “Red Curry Rice Balls”.
thaiName: ยำแหนมข้าวทอด

description:
“Yum Nang” ( ยำหนัง ) is a salad from Northern Thailand where dried buffalo skin is mixed with fresh herbs and possibly vegetables. The salad is dressed with a paste made from chilis, shallots, garlic and fermented fish sauce and sprinkled with sesame seeds before serving.
To use the buffalo skin, it must be soaked in water for several hours and then fried. As a substitute, beef jerky can be used in our regions. The name “Yum Nang” literally translates to “skin salad”.
thaiName: ยำหนัง

description: “Yum Normai Farang” ( ยำหน่อไม้ฝรั่ง ) is a Thai salad prepared with green baby asparagus. The asparagus is mixed with shallots, spring onions and herbs and then dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำหน่อไม้ฝรั่ง

description: "Yum Nuea" ( ยำเนื้อ ) is a Thai salad in which beef is dressed with tomatoes, cucumber or both and fresh herbs in a dressing of fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and chilies. The beef can be grilled, fried or braised . If the meat is grilled, the salad is also called “Yum Nuea Yang” ( ยำเนื้อย่าง ).
thaiName: ยำเนื้อ

summary: Rice Noodle Salad in Pad Thai Style
description: "Yum Pad Thai" ( ยำผัดไทย ) is a Thai rice noodle salad that uses similar ingredients to the well-known fried noodles, such as shrimp, tofu, mung bean sprouts and crushed peanuts. However, the salad also contains additional ingredients like shallots and fresh herbs. The dressing is also inspired by the wok dish and is prepared from tamarind paste, a generous amount of palm sugar, fish sauce and lime juice.
thaiName: ยำผัดไทย

summary: Salad with Water Spinach and Shrimp
description: The “Yum Pak Bung Grob” ( ยำผักบุ้งกรอบ ) is a salad with fried water spinach and shrimp. Before frying, the water spinach is coated in a simple batter made from flour, salt and pepper. The salad is dressed with a dressing made from coconut milk, fish sauce, lime juice, nam prik pao and palm sugar. For this salad I have also found the name “Yum Pak Bung Thod Grob” ( ยำผักบุ้งทอดกรอบ ).
thaiName: ยำผักบุ้งกรอบ

description: “Yum Pak Chi” ( ยำผักชี ) is a salad from northern Thailand where coriander is mixed with meat, fish or seafood and dressed with a dressing made from tamarind paste, fish sauce and sugar. There are also variants of this salad where regular coriander is mixed with long coriander and dill. All three herbs contain the name component “Pak Chi” in their Thai names.
thaiName: ยำผักชี

summary: Salad with Mustard Greens, Tomato and Peanuts
description: The "Yum Pak Khad" ( ยำผักบุ้งกรอบ ) with mustard greens, tomato and peanuts in a dressing with plenty of chili powder and turmeric is an exciting salad from Northern Thailand. Its ingredients and the spice mixture unusual for Thailand strongly remind of Burmese salads.
thaiName: ยำผักกาด

description: “Yum Plaa” ( ยำปลา ) is a salad with fried or grilled fish and fresh herbs. This salad is typically dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำปลา

description: “Yum Plaa Duk Foo” ( ยำปลาดุกฟู ) is a Thai dish with fried catfish and a mango salad. The fish is shredded, seasoned and then deep-fried at high heat so that it puffs up like a sponge. This fish is served with a salad made from green mango, Thai chilis, fresh herbs and a dressing of fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำปลาดุกฟู

description: "Yum Plaa Muek" ( ยำปลาหมึก ) is a squid salad prepared with fresh herbs and other fresh ingredients such as shallots, tomatoes or cucumbers. The squid pieces are often grilled or steamed before being dressed with lime juice, fish sauce, chilis and palm sugar and mixed with the remaining ingredients.
thaiName: ยำปลาหมึก

transcription: Yum Plaa Muek Jot Ma Prau
summary: Salad with Heart of Palm and Squid
description: “Yum Plaa Muek Jot Ma Prau” ( ยำปลาหมึกยอดมะพร้าว ) is a salad from Southern Thailand that contains squid, prawns, unripe green mango, carrots and heart of palm. The salad is dressed with lime juice, fish sauce, chilis and palm sugar.
alternativeNames: Yam Plaa Muek Jot Ma Prau
Yam Pla Mük Jot Ma Prau
Yum Plaa Muek Jod Ma Prao
thaiName: ยำปลาหมึกยอดมะพร้าว

description: “Yum Plaa Tuna” ( ยำปลาทูน่า ) or “Yum Tuna” ( ยำทูน่า ) is a Thai salad made from tuna, which is prepared with shallots and fresh herbs such as coriander. The whole thing is dressed with a spicy dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar and chilies. Canned tuna is also often used for this salad.
thaiName: ยำปลาทูน่า

summary: Spicy Salad with Fruit and Chicken
description: "Yum Pon­lamai Gai" ( ยำผลไม้ไก่ ) refers to a Thai salad prepared with chicken and a mixture of various fruits. All ingredients are dressed with a sauce made from fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar and chili powder. This dish can also be found under the similar name “Tam Ponlamai Gai” ( ตำผลไม้ไก่ ).
thaiName: ยำผลไม้ไก่

description: In some sources, “Yum Ruam Mit” ( ยำรวมมิตร ) or “Yum Ruam” for short ( ยำรวม ) is a Thai salad with glass noodles and many other ingredients such as prawns, squid, minced meat, Vietnamese sausage and peanuts. This salad is dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, chilies and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำรวมมิตร

summary: Salad with Pork, Chicken and Prawns
description: “Yum Saam Sahai” ( ยำสามสหาย ) is a salad with pork, chicken and prawns. These “Three Friends” (Saam Sahai) are dressed with fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar and served with fresh herbs. Sometimes tamarind juice and Nam Prik Pao are also used for the dressing.
thaiName: ยำสามสหาย

summary: Salad with Lotus Stems and Pork
description: “Yum Sai Bua Moo” ( ยำสายบัวหมู ) refers to a salad made from lotus stems and pork or minced pork. This is dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar. The salad can also be found under the name “Yum Lai Bua Moo” ( ยำไหลบัวหมู ).
thaiName: ยำสายบัวหมู

description: “Yum Sai Krok” ( ยำไส้กรอก ) is a simple salad where Sai Krok sausages are mixed with fresh herbs and dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำไส้กรอก

description: “Yum Sao Ni Bang” ( ยำสาวในบาง ) is the southern Thai name for a salad made from seafood, minced meat, carrots and palm heart. The salad is dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำสาวในบาง

description: The “Yum Sapparot Phuket” ( ยำสับปะรดภูเก็ต ) is a fruity salad from southern Thailand. In this salad, pineapple is mixed with chicken and prawns and then dressed with a mixture of Nam Prik Pao, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and lime juice. The whole dish is finally sprinkled with crushed peanuts or cashews.
thaiName: ยำสับปะรดภูเก็ต

description: "Yum Som O" ( ยำส้มโอ ) is a salad from central Thailand in which pomelo pieces are mixed with shallots, chilli, fresh herbs and other ingredients such as peanuts, cashews, dried or fresh prawns. The salad is then dressed with a dressing made from lime juice or tamarind paste, fish sauce and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำส้มโอ

summary: Pomelo Salad with Minced Meat and Shrimp
description: The “Yum Som O Boran” ( ยำส้มโอโบราณ ) is a salad from central Thailand. The name part “Boran” indicates a historical or ancient recipe. In addition to the eponymous pomelo, minced meat, shrimp, coconut chips and peanuts are dressed with an exciting sauce made from coconut milk, sugar, salt and chili flakes. The salad can also be found under the name “Yum Som O Sut Boran” ( ยำส้มโอสูตรโบราณ ).
thaiName: ยำส้มโอโบราณ

description: “Yum Talee” ( ยำทะเล ) is a spicy Thai salad with seafood such as squid, prawns or mussels. These are mixed with shallots and fresh vegetables such as tomatoes or celery. The salad is then dressed with lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar and Nam Prik Pao and garnished with fresh herbs.
thaiName: ยำทะเล

summary: Salad with Seafood and Heart of Palm
description: “Yum Talee Jot Ma Prau” ( ยำทะเลยอดมะพร้าว ) is a salad with seafood, heart of palm and julienned cucumber. The salad is dressed with fish sauce, lime juice, chili rings and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำทะเลยอดมะพร้าว

description: "Yum Thaeng Gwa" ( ยำแตงกวา ) is a Thai cucumber salad. It consists of raw cucumbers sliced into rounds or strips, along with shallots, chilis, and fresh herbs. The salad is dressed with lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar. Dried or fresh shrimp, tomatoes, or roasted peanuts are often added.
thaiName: ยำแตงกวา

description: "Yum Thua Nog" ( ยำถั่วงอก ) is a salad with Mung bean sprouts. The sprouts are mixed with chilis, shallots, and coriander leaves. It is dressed with a mixture of coconut milk, vinegar, roasted coconut, roasted peanuts, and fish sauce. There are also variants that use the usual “Nam Yum” mixture of fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำถั่วงอก

description: Yum Thua Phu" ( ยำถั่วพู ) is a salad made from finely chopped winged beans. These are usually mixed with seafood such as prawns or with minced meat and dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce and palm sugar. Depending on the recipe, the sauce can also be mixed with nam prik pao .
thaiName: ยำถั่วพู

summary: Winged Bean Salad with Minced Pork
description: “Yum Thua Phu Moo Sap” ( ยำถั่วพูหมูสับ ) is a Thai salad with winged beans and minced pork. It is dressed with a mixture of lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำถั่วพูหมูสับ

description: Yum Woon Sen" ( ยำวุ้นเส้น ) is a Thai glass noodle salad. It consists of glass noodles and meat, seafood or mushrooms and is dressed with lime juice, fish sauce, chili and palm sugar. The salad is then usually garnished with chopped herbs, shallots and sometimes peanuts.
thaiName: ยำวุ้นเส้น

summary: Glass Noodle Salad With Shiitake Mushrooms
description: “Yum Woon Sen Hed Hom” ( ยำวุ้นเส้นเห็ดหอม ) is a glass noodle salad with fried shiitake mushrooms and minced meat. These three ingredients are mixed with fresh herbs and some raw vegetables before being dressed with a dressing made from fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
thaiName: ยำวุ้นเส้นเห็ดหอม

description: “Yum Woon Sen Hoi” ( ยำวุ้นเส้นหอย ) is a northern Thai salad with glass noodles, snails and various herbs. It is dressed with a dressing made from lime juice, fish sauce, plaa ra, sugar, chili powder and shallots. The salad is finally garnished with sesame seeds. In northern Thailand, this salad is also known as “Sup Hoi Khom” ( ซุปหอยขม ).
thaiName: ยำวุ้นเส้นหอย

summary: Glass Noodle Salad With Pork Rinds
description: The “Yum Woon Sen Khaep Moo” ( ยำวุ้นเส้นแคบหมู ) is a heartier variation of the usual Yum Woon Sen salad. For the dressing, more Nam Prik Pao is used and crushed pork rinds are used instead of peanuts. There is also the somewhat longer name “Yum Woon Sen Khaep Moo Song Krueng” ( ยำวุ้นเส้นแคบหมูทรงเครื่อง ) for this glass noodle salad.
alternativeNames: Yam Wun Sen Khaep Mhu Song Krueng
Yam Woonsen Khaep Moo Song Krueng
Yum Woonsen Khaep Moo Song Krueng
thaiName: ยำวุ้นเส้นแคบหมู

transcription: Yum Woon Sen Moo Sap Talee
summary: Glass Noodle Salad with Minced Meat and Seafood
description: “Yum Woon Sen Moo Sap Talee” ( ยำวุ้นเส้นหมูสับทะเล ) is a variation of the well-known glass noodle salad Yum Woon Sen in which the noodles are mixed with minced meat and seafood and then sprinkled with crushed peanuts.
thaiName: ยำวุ้นเส้นหมูสับทะเล
